review: Will not do anything without paid subscription.
Tried several times to obtain a verification email and never receive one. I look in my spam folder to ensure all boxes are checked...MO JOY.

label_title: This is not ready for release!!! Avoid!!!!
review:
To say we are disappointed is an understatement!!  This App does not bring in your RV Trip Wizard route, it makes a new one!  
It took us in a loop around twice for no real reason. 
If you take a call while using it, it forgets where you were before the call and you have to reset the location. 
It does not show you on the turn by turn the exit number or direction, that is only audible!!
On our way to Pipestem WV, it took us down 2 roads that were not even close to be passable by our RV and yes we had the RV info listed correctly. We have to turnaround our 5th Wheel twice into empty fields that really torqued our rig and hitch!!
If you think this is a companion to RV Trip Wizard, it is not and RV Trip Wizard should really second guess offering this link!!
And to think I was going to buy this!! Give it some time and maybe but for now run away from this one!!!

First time using RV Life, it directed us to a road with a 8‚Äô10‚Äù bridge and our rig is 13‚Äô. I had chosen my model and it had the correct height. Luckily there was a ‚Äúone vehicle road we could get onto to avoid the bridge. Would not trust!
This is the best, and only app you‚Äôll need to find campgrounds in the US! Much better than any printed directory!
Unable to use for directions since I paid for the service it just crashes every time I try to get directions.

I was very excited to finally find an app to help navigate while driving a large Rv. Other apps I have used have routed me into dangerous situations. So far this app seems to work well. The only issues so far are the ETA is not even close to realistic. This needs to be fixed. Also does not support apple car play.

label_title: I have requested access many times and never received and email.
review: Never received access email

label_title: Can‚Äôt use app without correcting email
review:
There are two choices I have to try and use the app. Unfortunately, seeing an incorrect email address the only options this app offers are to go to an inbox that doesn‚Äôt exist or to resend an email request to a non-existing email address.
Uninstalled due to being unable to correct an email address.

Terrible app! This replaced Campground Review app and this has to be the most difficult to navigate! Have tried for hours to get even a list of campgrounds near a future location without success. Old app was much easier to use. Found KOA to be much more user friendly despite limiting campgrounds to KOAs. If I need directions I‚Äôll use Google Maps! I need campground listings and reviews not directions!

label_title: Great App for RVers on the move
review: I have found this App to be a valuable tool for making my decision on where to stay when I‚Äôm on the move.

label_title: Have enjoyed for years. Excellent RV info source for general rv owners and travel info.
review: Thanks

Rv‚Äôers hidden gems stores or activity hidden in cities.

Rig information: a place where RV‚Äôers can access their rig information in the app.

label_title: Long time web user, better with app
review: The app makes it much easier to find suitable RV parks than the web version.  Used it for years but now almost never as the app is better.  Browsing the map is very easy and lets me find parks on alternate routes.

This is s great site and my go to place to check campgrounds. Most accurate place for reviews. 
Love it.

Will someone please let me know when a good app for RV‚Äôers comes out? This is overpriced for nothing better than google directions that I already get for free. And the articles are all over the internet! As a new RV‚Äôer, I have loads to learn but it certainly wont happen here. When the newb can‚Äôt find something to learn, then there‚Äôs nothing new here, keep moving along.

I plotted a trip to a campground from my house just to test out what it suggested. You see there is a road that most gps apps will suggest because it is more direct, but it is a very sketchy, seasonal, un-maintained road even for a car. Given my rig size, this app gave the same suggested route that they all do which is on this road. If I didn‚Äôt know any better and trusted this ‚ÄúRV‚Äù specific gps app, I would have been stuck with no cell reception, or down the side of a cliff. 

They responded that they will update the map servers. Does this mean they are relying on real time human updates? 

I have my family in the truck when I am towing and this app would have literally put us in danger. Since it appears to just be a clone of google maps with worse interface and some poi pre-loaded; I will stick with google maps and hope that they implement a towing feature.
I use RVTripWizard.com as my go-to trip planning tool. I love that the RV Life app syncs with my planned trips.

This app has been very helpful so far for our RV trip up and down the east coast! I‚Äôd give it 5 stars if I could get the offline maps to work. I‚Äôve downloaded them, but I‚Äôm unable to access the maps on my iphone. The app works great though, when we have phone service.

Great app, navigation on and you never get lost. Finding a place is easy with the many resources available on this app. Thank you RV Life, Happy Camping, And real life true reviews. The traveling tips are fantastic, the app teaches you to become a professional Camper! If that‚Äôs possible!

I have a paid subscription service to RV Trip Wizard, one of this companies online companies. The paid version of this app integrates with RV Trip Wizard. When I first installed and ran this app, it asked for my email address to see if I already had an account on one of their websites and it recognized I was a user of RV Trip Wizard. I entered my RV Trip Wizard password and I was in. However, when I tried to view my RVTW saved trips, it wouldn't work. I sent a customer service request on July 4 of all days, and got a quick response. It turns out I had to log out of the app and back in again. No big deal, but something they should correct in the app.

I had created a trip to an Ohio state park about 3 hours from my house and used the "rv friendly" routing option. I tested the route with and without the rv friendly routing to see how the routing would be different. With standard routing, it had me take a country road the final 30 minutes and with the "rv friendly" routing, it had me take the Turnpike for most of that final 30 minutes, which made sense. However, it had me get off the turnpike and drive down a narrow but paved country road for about 15 minutes. That was odd, since a few miles further down the Turnpike there was an exit for a state route that would have taken much closer to the campground. That was odd, but the route didn't take me anywhere I couldn't get through so I didn't worry about it too much. Incidentally, RV Trip Wizard online gave me the better route using the state route but this did not carry over into the app integration.

On the way home, it routed me via the state route I mentioned above and that made more sense to me, but I don't know why it was different. However, the BIG deal is on my way home it attempted to route me down a road by my house that is closed from June to October 2019. Apple Maps, Google Maps, and Waze apps all knew to to route around this road closure but RV Life did not. In addition, there was a long backup on I-75 through Findlay due to construction. Again, RV Life did not alert at all or route around it, while Google Maps and Waze both did. 

Given these issues, I don't have enough trust in the GPS routing in the RV Life app to recommend using it. I will try again next Spring and hope the routing has improved. I will continue to use RV Trip Wizard to map the route and then export to Google Maps. That process is a pain, but I trust the routing more. Like any GPS routing, you need to use your common sense and consult a map if something doesn't seem right.
As a newbie I was overwhelmed with the apps available and what to use.  This app is the best.  Very easy to use and lots if helpful information.

label_title: Will not respond to cancellation requests. Out $22
review:
There is no information on who or where to contact about cancellation. Support will not respond. App seems ok but no better than what I used before. 
 Frustrating. Will be emailing support every day until they respond. Complete lack of customer support. They owe me $22 for a subscription I tried to cancel through their one and only support portal. If I ask for a refund from Apple they will grant it but then deny the CC used forever. That‚Äôs not a solution. 
 Get a true support group that responds. 

DO NOT INSTALL TO TEST UNLESS YOU WANT TO PAY ANNUALLY WITH MO WAY TO CANCEL.
I only use the app to locate campgrounds, hence I find the interface a bit annoying. However, it is highly useful for this purpose and I definitely recommend it for the RV travelers out there.
I can‚Äôt seem to get the app to sync with my RV Trip Wizard account to load my trips. Is this part live yet?
I just started using this app and so far the information has been accurate. Having reports from actual campers and not the campgrounds themselves makes a difference.
Great planning tool!  The best I have found for finding RV parks, reading current reviews, and making reservations.  This app saves a lot of time researching your trips.

label_title: Like what I see so far
review: Seems like a great app haven‚Äôt used it much yet. Has everything I was looking for will see how the GPS works within the next few weeks.

Developer doesn't say up front that some features cost extra which I regard as sleazy. IMHO this company has been buying up and monopolizing good services and apps one by one and ruining them while quietly adding fees that didn't exist before.

This is an average app. That‚Äôs not a bad thing. Average means it does what I expect it to do. However, you want it to be 5 star awesome- implement CarPlay. I don‚Äôt want to fiddle with my phone or buy a car mount when I can simply plug it into my head unit.
This is NOT a free app! You won‚Äôt be able to use ANY of the features unless you upgrade to the paid version! Now I have to deal with trying to delete the account I created. Ridiculous!
Can not get email confirmation.    Looked in trash.   Can not recover - locked up

I am so appreciative of an app that is specifically for RV travelers and their unique requirements and limitations. 

However, there doesn‚Äôt appear to be a way to plot a trip that starts somewhere other than my current location; this hinders the ability to plan ahead. 

Also, when I go to the Trips menu, I get a page about downloading a demo of Trip Wizard that doesn‚Äôt do anything. The Trip button is no use if Trip Wizard is no longer available, and it keeps taking me back to the Trip Wizard Demo page. 

Since Trip planning is the main point of the app, but the Trip Planner isn‚Äôt useful for planning any trip that doesn‚Äôt start at my current location, then I can‚Äôt give it 5 stars.
This app in conjunction with Goggle/Apple maps is all you need to travel and find excellent campgrounds along the way. We travel full time and it is our ‚Äòtravel bible‚Äô.

This is our 5th season at Mill Brook RV Park in Kingston  NH.  We love it here and have made some wonderful friends. Everyone is always so helpful and friendly.  We come up from FL. so we can spend time with our Kids and Grandkids.  This is our Northern Paradise and we love it!!
Kathy & Barry Blair
Nice RV Park, very clean, nice pond, not far off I-20. Pads are gravel but drain very well, enjoyable stay.
I find it very informative when I‚Äôm looking for a campground or resort.  It‚Äôs a great app for campers to have.

Good app for travel, helpful to plot a course and find things we need that other RV‚Äôers my or may not. I use this in conjunction with other apps and maps. 

We travel in a converted sprinter and don‚Äôt need same things big-rig RV‚Äôs do (sewer, 50amp, pull-through sites), adversely we prefer some smaller sites that large setups can‚Äôt navigate with more privacy and aren‚Äôt big gravel lots (woods, fire pits sometimes, etc).

SO, good news is you can read reviews and poke around and see if the site‚Äôs for you. I do wish you could filter results by some things that are applicable to ME and other small RV‚Äôers - I‚Äôve said as much in my review to the developers, people camping in smaller rigs is a big movement and there‚Äôs nothing this good for that application. BUT, this tool is the best one out, just use it with your brain engaged and you‚Äôll be fine, big or small rig.
Excellent!!!
I am finding a lot of information that I will follow and keep my eyes and ears tuned to things that one needs to be aware of. I‚Äôll revisit and update after making an extended trip this summer.
Downloaded this app and was sent a confirmation email. Clicked on email and told there were problems and I should contact support.  But no way to do that.  Not exactly pleased.

I was so excited when I found this app. I have used their web based program and share my reviews on trips. I initially struggled to use as the AT&T connectivity was only visible at their website but not in the app. I reached out and they added the AT&T connectivity to the app. I find this tool and the support team exceed my expectations. I have already shared with family and friends!

I stumbled upon this because I was a fan of the RV Park Review website, which the instant app has incorporated. I‚Äôm very impressed with how intuitive this app is. I‚Äôm currently using the free version but will consider the premium version down the road. I like that is uses Google maps instead of Apple maps, which is a negative with The popular Allstays app.

label_title: Updated version of an already great app. The best on the market today.
review:
This new and updated version are worth every cent!

Me and my wife are full timers since four years and this is the first and only app that really work.

Easy to find and compare RV parks and campgrounds with the new map function. You can plan either ahead or when you actually are on the road.

Presented in a VERY informative way where you see where yo are, and what campgrounds are nearby and IN THE DIRECTION YOU ARE TRAVELING!

Other apps shows within a certain amount of miles, but if it is in the wrong direction not much use.

I bought the paid version so I could download the app and use it off line. That is the biggest difference from the free version. And two weeks when traveling on hwy 10 on our way to LA I had use for it since Verizon went down to 2G linger than expected.

Also great when you plan a route and have poor internet.

A new function that I like from last week, is that finally I can use my iPad in landscape mode. For me that was important.

It also tells me that the developer does not just want to cash in short term, but really have the intention to serve us users long-term.

I have seen some fellow RVers complain it is not complete. Nothing is complete and remember - even the sun has spots...

Highly recommended from BasilFawly!
Where you read individual reviews for a campground It says ‚Äúno reviews yet‚Äù even though it says there are reviews. This is true for every campground. Something is broken.

label_title: My GoTo App for RV Travel
review: Simply the one App I use for RV Camping
Used old site frequently. Since the change I cannot enter site. Unless
The old RV Park Reviews app wasn‚Äôt anything fancy, but it was functional. The new app just crashes while loading.

Used to use RV Park Reviews a lot to find a campground while traveling. Since they changed to this site cannot filter by Big Rig access without purchasing subscription. Also not near as easy to use to find sites. No happy with change.
You are paying your developer way to much money. We are RVers. You should hire someone who actually has an RV and understands what we are looking for without all the BS.
Jobless for some of our jobs are going through our first day

I tried to use this in conjunction with my primary RV Trip planner (the web based subscription site by the same company), but the APP does not display in landscape position and is thus, so far, not useable with my iPad keyboard device and my workflow (most of which are landscape position based). As far as the other features of the APP, I never got that far and will not use it, (staying with their web based reviews).
Tried searching for CG, entered city and state. Search found nothing? Map doesn‚Äôt even move to location searched. Delete!

label_title: Amazing how much you could mess up a good thing
review: I was trying to get info on parks in Florida while I am in the Northeast all it gives me access to is local parks. Well that‚Äôs useless, thank goodness for AllStays. Well on the bright side I got more space on my IPad by deleting this app.

The old RVPark Reviews was easy to use. We don‚Äôt need all the ‚Äúfor you‚Äù maps and info. Trying to find parks in a certain area has a learning curve - can only get there at the bottom of the filters pages. I‚Äôll use it but not pleased with the changes.

label_title: Was decent, now I can‚Äôt use it.
review: With the last update, the map constantly jumps, zooms and moves. It doesn‚Äôt stop. I can‚Äôt select and area and stay in one spot when trying to find campgrounds. It‚Äôs currently useless.
This replaces RV Park Reviews app, except it now is filled with cheap and nasty ads, and couldn‚Äôt find the first park I searched for. Don‚Äôt waste your time.

label_title: Time to Find Another RV App
review: What a sleazy slimy company RV Life is. The free version contains terrible chat ads with skimpy dressed underage girls. Don‚Äôt want these ads? You gotta pay up. I guess all your 19 year old male customers are happy though.

A) you can only view it on iPad one direction, so if you are charging it‚Äôs very awkward
B) your app tracks my location even though my location services are off- this is something other apps allow you to choose- I DO NOT care what campgrounds are near me so CLUTTER CRAP
C) no help or access to tech support so......
This is a sketchy app that as of today am NOT going to buy in app stuff if this part can‚Äôt run smoother

I used to leave reviews on all the major sites including this one. But my reviews here tend to be edited heavily or not accepted at all if they are even slightly critical. They don‚Äôt accept reviews if you were unable or unwilling to stay. 

Once they responded to me and said, ‚Äúthe owner denies saying that‚Äù. The problem is that I didn‚Äôt reference a conversation in my review.  It was a good review! 

My guess is that they are supported by the campgrounds and clear all reviews with them. Could be that is why there are so many campgrounds with no reviews at all.

label_title: Why try to fix something that wasn‚Äôt broke?
review: RV Park Reviews was great on its own. Should have left it alone.
This app is useless.  I always used RV Park reviews and was very helpful.  Will delete this garbage and use Good Sam app.  What a mistake!!!
First ad pop up resembled porn. No thanks!

Oh boy, did you screw it up! You took RV Park Reviews, to me an indispensable review system to check out parks before reserving. It‚Äôs gone. I tried to lookup Pilot Mountain State Park, and it doesn‚Äôt even show up. Say goodbye!

This took over RV Park Reviews which had its own issues, but was at least OK. They were bad at fixing issues. 
RVLife is much worse. Search function is horrible and mostly does not work at all. Don‚Äôt know where some reviews of parks went from the old site. Rating system is a farce. So many parks have high ratings here that are totally undeserving. Nothing like going from bad to worse. After this review I‚Äôm just deleting the app, because it‚Äôs worthless and I have others I can use.
Used to be great. No so much anymore.

This app took over the RV Park Reviews app. 

I trusted RV Park Reviews and used them often, including contributing my reviews.  But the reviews from that app did not come over to the new app. Therefore, ratings are skewed and information is incomplete. 

If you are going to take something over, then please bring it ALL. Alternatively, provide a way to access that historical data.
Won‚Äôt let me create a userid. Maybe you can fix that sometime.
Uninstalled and deleted. Sorry, will try it again once you have fixed this issue.
Title says it all
Major change to app.  It‚Äôs not user friendly due not being able to rotate on the IPad.  The case that my iPad sits in does not rotate. Needs to get fixed.
The maps are nonexistent. The app is useless. It is too bad you are deprived the option of staying on the predecessor app that worked flawlessly.

label_title: Does not display in Landscape mode
review: The original RV parks review app had this same problem, took years for them to fix it, looks like here we ago again..

I used RV Parky all the time and the app rotated on my iPad to the horizontal length.  This app is not rotating when I set my iPad on this side.  I used RV Parky with my keyboard all the time looking for placed to stay.  I won‚Äôt be using this app unless it fixed to rotate on the iPad.  No, it‚Äôs not my settings on my iPad.  All my other apps rotate.  Thanks.

label_title: RV Park Reviews now RV Life
review:
Nice new features. 
Old app and online .com show reviewers site number. 
Please continue this in RV Life. Knowing site numbers definitely helps choosing sites. 
Thank you
So far copilot was good, but on new ios 13.2 app lost voice navigation :(
Not truck driver friendly, this app will certainly get a professional truck driver in Big trouble. Instead of taking driver to a Business with dock you will end up in residential cul de sacs .

We had high hopes for this as we had difficulties with low bridges and RV unfriendly routes on our last trip. But 1st time iut with this app it took us straight to a closed road and then wanted to route us down THREE roads that were designated ‚ÄúNo Trucks‚Äù in our 31.5‚Äô motorhome. What‚Äôs up with THAT?!!

I was not able to use this purchase on my trip to Ireland because I couldn‚Äôt figure out how to use it.  Therefore it was a total waste of money and time.  I would not recommend this to anyone who isn‚Äôt highly tech savvy.

We bought this app to help us navigate in Germany.  However, it was useless because it pronounced German street names as English words, so we couldn‚Äôt understand what it was saying. In contrast, the GPS that came with our rental car (a welcome perk because the car we reserved wasn‚Äôt available) spoke in English but pronounced the street names properly (strasse with the last e pronounced). The CoPilot app was a complete waste of money!

I am a pilot car driver. My job takes me all over the United States with oversized loads. It is imperative that we follow the route assigned.  This app makes it simple to plan a route and make changes.  At first I had some difficulty but it was only my experience which was causing the issues. After a short learning period I was able to plan a route in a matter of minutes.
There are a couple of requests which would be very useful.

 #1   I would like to have a measuring tool.   Sometimes I need to know how far it is to my next waypoint. Or from one waypoint to another.

#2  It would be super handy to be able to share a trip I have saved with another copilot user.  If there are multiple people taking the same route this would ensure all users have the exact same route programmed.

Thanks to the developers of this super fantastic APP.

Kevin
Worst gps I have tried for RVs. Can‚Äôt even locate Nashville TN.  Route planning is useless
It would be nice if you had the option of turning off the recalculate so it wouldn‚Äôt recalculate every time you come off route, other than that I think it‚Äôs a pretty good app

I‚Äôve reloaded it on many iPhone upgrades with no issues.  It also works well on my Android tablet.  

Best feature hands down is certified speedometer. Not promoted as such but it always matches the traffic warning lights along the roadway. This is particularly important for me as a commercial trucker. 

I paid $150 for the trucker version and rely on it daily along with Google Maps and Google Earth to do logistic planning. 

I also use Active Traffic. 

Five stars!

Off line maps of the world, that‚Äôs the good part. And not much else. Login never works on certain device. You can‚Äôt copy paste the long password. You can‚Äôt make it visible either so you don‚Äôt know if you have typed it correct either. You can‚Äôt use copied address. Constantly bugs me about the notifications to turn on....
The description was not clear that it was a trial offer. :-/

I‚Äôm like the features in this app and find it very helpful and intuitive in bad traffic situations. My only recommendation would be to incorporate some form of weather info and radar overlay. Other than that I love it.

Lots of room for improvement: map only zooms out so much and you can‚Äôt really see what‚Äôs up ahead of you, gps will continually try to reroute you the same way it was taking you even if there is a faster way found by another source. Map does give a few options for routes but doesn‚Äôt let you customize if you want to avoid an area or take a certain route, when you select avoid it will circle you around the avoided area first and then bring you right back to where you were trying to avoid. Would be nice if it calculated toll cost like Rand McNally, could be a lot simpler and easier to find points of interest (truck stops, rest areS etc)
Have used it for years. Always updating. Good support
Routing was awful, contacted Copilot they told me Apple would refund, not true ! I wasted $29.00 !

Let‚Äôs see... I tested this app for my 18 wheeler and my personal car. Both versions had several things wrong. Mostly speeds were wrong. With my personal car version? It would always try to make me enter truck parking areas and exit interstates. Only to tell me to immediately get back onto the interstates. ‚ÄúHow stupid can a developer be?!?‚Äù, I thought to myself. Well, with the way this app functions? The answer is... A developer can be just as stupid as the amount of money he/she may try to steal from people, for a horrible app. Just like this one. Do not waste your money on this app.

As a pro truck driver I bought this app for $150 a few years ago, and it worked for my purpose. Customer service is incredibly slow to respond, which is why I give three out of five stars, but otherwise a good app for truckers.
Put us on The Blue Ridge Parkway. I know that Parkway and I know you can‚Äôt take a 37 foot motorhome, tunnels are too low. Never using it again!  I would like my money refunded to me.

I purchased this app when google address search was supported.
But I hated the most when they removed google search engine.
I don‚Äôt recommend it anymore.

25 years. I‚Äôve started with pc miler by ALK then came co-pilot I used on the laptop. Then finally the phone app. I ran Rand Mc. along side Co-pilot and would laugh at how Rand was trying to route me through cities and town to get to my destination. Co-pilot was way better maybe taking you to the next exit or even using the bypass around major cities. Those days are gone now I guess. 

It doesn‚Äôt post the truck speed on split speed limits. 

It doesn‚Äôt notify you of scales coming up. 

I can‚Äôt find save current location to add to address folder. 

You need internet to find fuel stops. 

And routing has become frustrating. Practical is a joke anymore. 

I‚Äôm staying with Co-pilot because the traffic alert is great and I paid the 300+ years ago for the truck app. I will continue to use it as a backup to the Rand. But I can no longer recommend Co-pilot as a truck app especially since they are asking for a monthly fee. 

Should they return to improve this app and start adding useful features for trucks and truck navigation ie: weather and construction warnings scales and truck fuel stops in route like what is on the ALK app. then I would gladly change my rating and review. 
Co-pilot has lost their way.

So i bought the app to help stay away from low bridges since I picked up a new 5th wheeler. First big trip was to West Point NY from Plymouth MA. The app took me through old trucking routes and numerous towns, lots of light etc. to make matters worse, to apps wanted me to take a road that was inaccessible from the highway. I had to use google maps to get me there. 

From there, I drove to Maryland and Virginia and back without a problem until I reached Connecticut. Again, instead of staying on Route 95, it took me through small towns again....

My last trip was to the western part of Massachusetts. The app Was working fine until it took me off the highway onto the main drag, had me circle around through some neighborhood a 5th wheeler shouldn‚Äôt be and right back to the exit I took and back on the highway. 

Pat but not least, it doesn‚Äôt recognize my home address....

Dave

Traveling to Disney the app took me off the Interstate and then right back on twice. Put me in a dangerous situation with a 31‚Äô travel trailer. No response from support. No refund options. DON‚ÄôT BUY THIS APP.

This app is almost great, some have complained about things they could have fixed in settings, I say learn the app and it‚Äôs features/settings before giving a negative review. I am a pilot and use navigation programs for aircraft and they are excellent as you would expect, this app is close but still needs just a bit more work to make it a bit more user friendly. Making a rout you want instead of what the computer wants can be a challenge until you learn the idiosyncrasies of the app. For those who complain about it directing them to a closed road or a low bridge I say this is a driving aid, you are the driver, stay alert stay in front of your vehicle.

I really like the app, but one feature I can‚Äôt believe it doesn‚Äôt have is the ability to drop a pin to navigate to. I drive to a lot of wildlife areas and boat launches that I can find on the map, but I have no way to navigate to that location. I need to be able to drop a pin on the spot and have CoPilot take me there. Add this feature and it would be 5 stars !!!
I‚Äôve been using this app for years, we are moving to Japan but it‚Äôs not on the list of the world map. I would really like to use this app there.

label_title: Is developer open to user comments for improvements?
review:
I drive a truck and I am frequently in the northeast where there are many low bridges and truck restriction routes. So I need quality info. So far I find Copilot clumsy. I still run Google Maps simultaneously to ensure I take the right or best route. I got a ticket in NY as approached the Midtown Tunnel after Copilot directed me to miss my exit from the Long Island Expressway to the BQE because it changed my route without asking me or alerting me. This mistake sent me toward the tunnel, which I knew I could not take. I was looking for a way out. Fortunately the cops helped me out of a jam, but gave me a ticket in the process. 

Here are my specific issues. 
Co pilot problems 

1. Changes route without asking me or letting me know 
2. Highway and city names too small to read. Does not get larger when I zoom in. 
3. Has routed me on some routes that are clearly not truck routes and physically impossible for a truck (and yes, my profile has 53‚Äô trailer with 13‚Äô6‚Äù  height).
4. Algorithms find very convoluted routes that are inefficient, jump off highways and add unnecessary miles and time, and finds routes that go right through traffic with lots of intersections and lights. 
5. Often picks a route in the opposite direction with a u-turn to get back on track. 
6. Does not know how to control the play/pause function when connected to radio/speakers. Often goes silent. 
Causes me to miss turns/exits because of #1 above. 
7. Too many colors and not clearly identified routes, worse in night mode. Look at Google and iMaps. Very clear. 
8. When I try to force it to take a specific route, rather than going direct through the desired route, it goes through the original route, then back-tracks and adds lots of twists. 
I would appreciate info as to what developer is doing to fix these problems, or I have search for another app, especially since I am paying for this Trucker GPS. I really need an effective and efficient trucker GPS, especially in the northeast where getting off route can be very dangerous. If this one doesn‚Äôt get fixed, I have to search for another. Paying $10 a month for an app that I have to constantly second guess doesn‚Äôt cut it.

label_title: Great app and easy to use!
review: It‚Äôs a very easy to use app, the directions are pretty well right on also, just use a little common sense and it‚Äôs a great tool to have in the truck at all times! Highly recommend ü§î

I bought this years ago & was annoyed that my purchase didn‚Äôt count for anything when it moved to a subscription model. However, I need a reliable GPS on my phone for our RV travels. This isn‚Äôt it. On the first trip while using it Copilot directed us down a road that we should never have been on. I don‚Äôt blindly follow GPS instructions but neither Apple Maps nor my paper map indicated anything to raise alarms. After we turned into this narrow country road with swamp each side and no shoulders we reached a sign saying that there was no access for vehicles over 1/2 ton or longer than 20 feet. We‚Äôre 16 tons and 40 feet and there was no area to turn around. Backing half a mile down a country road to turn back into a busy state highway was great fun. 
Copilot wouldn‚Äôt reroute. It kept telling us to turn back onto that road. 
The second time, it routed us onto city streets that had low (very low, one was 9‚Äô) overpasses. Luckily, I picked up on that before we turned off. Then the app wouldn‚Äôt reroute. 
Third & last time, I ran copilot concurrently with MapQuest, and ran Apple Maps on the iPad alongside. Copilot lost signal and ran around in circles, then tried to turn us around to start the route over. Neither of the others lost our position. Copilot is now uninstalled and I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to any truck or RV driver.

I bought this app many years ago specifically for the RV features. Now those have been removed and the only way to get them is to get an annual subscription. Sorry, I‚Äôm not paying a subscription for something I previously had.
It‚Äôs good, just wish it had a few more features like satellite view and maybe if it wasn‚Äôt so zoomed in so close all the time. I adjust it out but it doesn‚Äôt stay that way long

Pointless if (I have to have an account and) your paste doesn‚Äôt work when creating an account. If that‚Äôs an actual security measure (can paste into email field) I shudder to think what your actual privacy measures are. Deleted.

This review is intended for professional drivers only. I almost never write reviews on anything, but this app deserves some attention. As you can guess, I have a pretty high opinion of this app, giving it 4 stars, but keep in mind my rating is a comparative one, based on my experience with 3 other ‚Äútruck‚Äù GPS apps.

What I like about it:

The interface is beautifully laid out with large selection buttons, making doing almost anything on the app easy and it‚Äôs pleasing to look at and use. 

The navigation for trucks is at least as good as fixed units from Garmin or RM (I have used both and currently use Garmin for primary navigation). There are some bugs, which I will mention later, but it‚Äôs still better and more reliable than other apps. 

The included POI‚Äôs (truck stops, rest areas, etc.) is good. I can‚Äôt rave about this feature for any app or fixed based unit because they are all lacking in my opinion, but this one is on-par with most, at least in terms of quantity. I do have a big POI issue though, which I will mention later. 

Lots of options for customization whether it‚Äôs how the map looks, voice prompts, route choices and much more. 

The ‚ÄúActive Traffic‚Äù is probably better than Garmin and I would say equal to Google. I also like the way it can display a traffic bar alongside the map, making it very easy to see where the slowdowns are on your route. 

While not as important, this app does something I‚Äôve never seen from any other GPS, fixed unit or app: in most cases it will show you the layout of ‚Äúroads‚Äù within a truck stop or customer lot. And it‚Äôs pretty accurate. Can guide you correctly through a truck stop maze right to the fuel island. 

For those that don‚Äôt run the posted speed limit, the app allows you to set a ‚Äúgovernor‚Äù speed to help more accurately estimate drive and arrival times. Coupled with the traffic feature, this can allow for some very accurate ETA‚Äôs. That said it would be even better if it would just let you set a ‚Äúdrive‚Äù speed, because if you drive faster than the speed limit, it will still only calculate ETA based on the limit (I don‚Äôt know many truckers who actually drive 55 while in California... most are doing 58-62). 

When planning a route, it will show you up to 3 different truck-legal options. In addition, after you‚Äôve chosen a route, customizing it is a breeze. This is helpful especially if you just want to alter one little section or a customer has provided specific directions for the ‚Äúlast mile‚Äù. This function is easier and better to use than any other GPS I‚Äôve used, including fixed units. 

What I don‚Äôt like:

Two big things I don‚Äôt like that are largely responsible for my not rating this app 5 stars and even leave me questioning the 4 star rating I did give it. 

First, the cost. For an app that runs on user-purchased hardware (aka smartphone), the price is ridiculously expensive. At $9.99 mo. or $99.99 yr., it can easily add up to as much as or more than a fixed unit over time. I think a one-time purchase price would make sense. Would I be willing to pay $99.99 to have it for life? Probably. It‚Äôs good enough to justify that amount once, but not year after year. 

Second, and this may not be as important to some as it is to me, but when searching for upcoming POI‚Äôs on-route, it will only look about 30 miles ahead. If you‚Äôre like me and start looking for a lunch/fuel/night stop at least a couple of hours out, this app is useless. Because of that, I find myself switching between this app and others, like TP, to figure out what‚Äôs up ahead in the next 100-200 miles, then switching back, doing a POI search near a specific city, then adding the POI to my route. I‚Äôve contacted customer support about this and to their credit, and my surprise, they actually responded and did a follow up. Unfortunately, their response was basically ‚Äúsorry, but that‚Äôs just the way it is and there‚Äôs nothing we can do about it‚Äù. This flaw and their response make no sense to me because if you do a POI search for ‚Äúnearby‚Äù, the resulting list is long and can list places as far as 300 miles away. The problem is you have no way of knowing if any of those places are on your current route or not.

Other, more minor things, I don‚Äôt like include not having the ability to set alerts for things that are important, especially for professional drivers, like upcoming weigh stations, sharp curves or steep grades. These should be basic implementations in a truck-based app, especially one at this price point. 

The zoom control on the 3D map is very limited. Want a wide view of your route? Forget it. You can only zoom out about a mile or two. Fortunately, the 2D map doesn‚Äôt have the same limitations and even has an auto ‚Äúzoom to next turn‚Äù option. My Garmin does this also AND does it in 3D view. Since I‚Äôm primarily using this app as a ‚Äúbackup‚Äù to my Garmin, I kind of like the 2D view to give me different perspective. One little bug though is that when I am more than about 20 miles from the next turn, it displays the map in a ‚Äúnorth up‚Äù orientation even though I have my settings for ‚Äúheading up‚Äù. Once within 20-25 miles, it switches to heading up view. 

Another minor bug I found was that it planned a route exactly as I wanted, but after parking for the night and starting the next morning, it had changed my route. I cancelled the navigation and re-entered the destination, but it still wouldn‚Äôt take me on this particular road. So, first it would and then it wouldn‚Äôt. Have no idea why. 

I‚Äôve found two stretches of interstate 5, one southbound in California and one northbound in Oregon, that the app showed as closed when they actually weren‚Äôt. If you zoomed in to the right spot, you could see where the road was black, marking it as closed. Because of this, it wouldn‚Äôt even let me manually alter the route to force it to stay on the interstate. Took me forever to figure out why it was trying to route me off a valid highway and take me an extra 100 miles out of the way.

label_title: You pay once for a full app and then
review: You have to pay again yearly! That‚Äôs a no no for me.

Asked the app to plot a route from Mechanicsburg, PA to East Meadow, NY... The app provided the first turn audibly, and then the audio quit for the rest of the trip!!! We kept monitoring the screen, and it failed to display my need to head to the George Washington Bridge!!! After the app finally recognized that I was on the bridge, and correctly routed me down the Clearview Expwy, however [And this is a HUGE HOWEVER!!!], the app wanted me to continue on the expressway beyond the point where trucks are not permitted!!!!! I am deleting the app, and highly advise against its use!!!!!

I purchased this app specifically because it is supposed to be designed for RV use. First attempt to use it was to go to a campground in N Calif. The app didn‚Äôt have the campground in its database although both Google and Apple navigation had the campground on their database.  Second use worked ok it it was to an RV park in a city.  Third time it guided me down a narrow winding dirt road that was barely passable in our 30 foot RV when a perfectly good paved route was available ( same route as Google maps).  This was exactly the sort of situation I had hoped this app would avoid. It appears that it is no improvement over Google maps. Also I find the interface to be not terribly intuitive. Wish someone would come up with an app that is truly designed for RVs

label_title: Not what it used to be - No support.
review: App locked up with my iphone 8plus and my wife‚Äôs also twice within one day. Messaged support and the response was reinstall the app and it should be ok. Not so and the rep didn‚Äôt even read my post or didn‚Äôt understand it. After several responses I gave up. This was a good product at one time, no longer the case. Back to Waze as it much more stable and reliable. Google maps or Apple maps is a better alternative and they are free not $15 per year.

I have this app specifically for when we travel with our RV and haul our Toyota Camry behind. This directed us down gravel roads with turns so tight, the front end of my Toyota is a mess from the dolly being jack knifed, causing the front end of my brand new car to hit the back of my RV. This is unacceptable. If I could score this app lower than a 1, I would. I am attempting contact customer support with no success. Not only did I literally put my family‚Äôs lives in danger at the dangerous road conditions through a gravel road in the Smoky Mountains, but my brand new car is smashed. I had my car type and length in the app, but that did not matter. I can not explain how terrible this trip was. I would NOT recommend this app and in fact will now have to pay quite a lot to fix my car. Ridiculous.

I bought this app a few years ago and it came with RV navigation.....the main reason I bought it. Since that time, they have done many updates and have conveniently removed the very feature I BOUGHT AND PAID for.
Now, if I desire to access the feature I originally BOUGHT AND PAID for, I have to pay them a yearly subscription fee.
To me, That is outright FRAUD and stealing.
So, now I must move on to another app that isn‚Äôt so underhanded and dishonest.
Update: Customer Service refuses to even acknowledge my issue. They are sending me many emails to pay a subscription for a product I already paid for.

First time use of the app on our last trip. Three separate times it routed us off the main road we were driving on, had us go a mile or two, make a U turn and go back to the same exit we just got off and told us to get back on. Not fun in unfamiliar areas pulling a 38‚Äô camper. We just ended up using Waze instead. Way better. Hope I can get a refund.

I like the idea of Putting in the height of your vehicle. I drive Limousine‚Äôs for a living and I am in multiple vehicles every day. But the app is not that user-friendly or I am just new to it. I‚Äôm debating whether to pay $29 a year for the RV GPS. Strictly for the fact of height requirements of bridges. This is not an option with other mapping apps even the big guys, nothing worse when you‚Äôre driving a motorcoach and it routes you down a street where the bridge is too small or low and you have to turn around or something else happens that is not so favorable.
Before used to work nice after a couple updates the GPS is designed to make a bigger circle more miles to get to you in ditches ,
Very slow to render map or even aquire a GPS signal.  I-80 in Lincoln ne
I Drive local fuel truck works great much better then maps app it‚Äôs made for trucks won‚Äôt take you somewhere you can‚Äôt get out of little pricey but for me worth it

I‚Äôm so disappointed in this app. I was looking for a good app for routing while driving an RV to make sure the roads were passable. This app was expensive for the RV subscription and quite honestly I will probably delete it in favor of Waze or just back to google. It beeps loudly and incessantly for often no reason. It often showed me off road when I was clearly on the road. When I needed it most at an intersection where I could choose several paths it froze completely and came back too late with the path I had chosen against and wanted me to back track to get there. It refused to show me the original path I had planned on. At that point I gave up and pulled out waze. I still can‚Äôt believe I wasted $30 on an app I don‚Äôt trust and probably won‚Äôt use again. Oh and beyond all that, the interface is incredibly non intuitive and hard to program a trip to begin with. Total waste of money.

With its built-in maps, copilot is useful when traveling by train or bus to see where you are. And how far you have to go.
Find your current location by ‚Äúsave location for reporting‚Äù then go to map feedback to find the name of the town. Then enter that town name (and center of town) to display it in an expandable map. [suggestion: put all that in a single button]
Love the functionality of this app but really needs car play.

label_title: Wrong Directions First Time I Used It
review: I wanted to test out the app so I chose a route that would put me on a highway 5 minutes from my house. At an intersection where I would turn right to get on the highway that was 50 yards away this stupid app was telling me to turn left, straight into town. It‚Äôs already deleted from my phone.
Need Apple CarPlay support.

label_title: Appear to have lost my suscription
review:
On the road and suddenly I lose my route. Wants me to resubscribe. I just paid for it within the last week. 

If you go into your account, there is a setting to ‚Äúrefresh‚Äù account. That fixed it. But gave me gray hairs!

I do like that thus far it takes me on RV safe roads. CPG, need to fix this bug, or give a warning on the reset, with the purchase.

label_title: Very small database of roads and campgrounds
review: This app needs a major update of roads and campgrounds, amount other things. Could not recommend!
This is my # 1, go to gps truck map on the market. Best trucking app ever wouldn‚Äôt leave home without it.

label_title: App only loads when it wants to
review: The app works great when it decides to work. Most of the time it doesn‚Äôt do anything when you open it. The copilot logo comes up, and that‚Äôs all. It doesn‚Äôt make it to the navigation screen most of the time. When it works I have to keep the app open in order to use it. If I accidentally close it and try to reopen it right away, I‚Äôm out of luck. Like any other app, if I leave it open in the background and go any length of time without using it actively, it reloads itself. Unlike every other app I use, it doesn‚Äôt actually reload when it does this. Please fix this.

I had high hopes for this app since it replaced one of the most popular RV compatible apps on the market. 

But then it tried to route me through a tiny narrow street in downtown Livermore CA that made no sense to select versus sticking to the truck route round the old downtown, as a way to pass through town.  Luckily my wife noticed we were headed towards a cluster and busted out Google Maps which got us through town in one piece.

Once not driving I checked out the routes chosen by copilot and by sygic using the same vehicle parameters....6 tons, 50 length, 8ft wide, 13‚Äô tall....for my trailer plus truck. 

Sure enough, copilot kept sending me through downtown Livermore along first street.  Sygic bypassed downtown on roads that were more appropriate for a rig just passing through.

Living in the mountains of WV and pulling a rig totaling 55 plus feet leave me wanting to stay straight roads as much as possible. This app often suggests routes that are narrow and very curvy. Selecting a two lane road verse a four lane to save a few minutes seems to me like bad logic. I'm not even confident that the selected route considers my rig dimensions,when making some of these suggested routes. Being a new user, I may grow more confident but based on my limited use It is not worth the cost.

label_title: It only has to misrouted you 1 time in a 43‚Äô RV to lose trust in it
review:
This app gives you the ability to enter the dimensions of your rig and I would assume it would use that information to give you relevant features. For example, search for truck stops along my route. Nope!  I can search for gas stations, but that doesn‚Äôt include truck stops. If I need a truck stop, I have to search for it by name. So, I use multiple apps (RVParky is awesome) to find truck stops and then search for it by name in Copilot. 

Another issue with this app is there is no way to update a map and save changes, instead you have to remember the name of the file (including capitalization) and save over the file.  Not a deal breaker, but a sign of rookie developers. This is a simple change and should have been done from the beginning. 

There are a lot of features in this app that you better get familiar with before you learn the hard way. For example, I included a highway service area as a stop and the service area divides the cars from the trucks. The program told me to stay right (cars) but I stayed left since I‚Äôm in a large RV. Apparently the lanes were just far enough apart that the app routed me 45 minutes out of the way and took me right back to the same service area. I will edit my trip from now on by deleting stops as I come to them. This delay cost me a night at a campground while we slept at another service area for the night. So, this app has already cost me more money than just purchasing it.

I would think long and hard about choosing this over a Rand McNally GPS!  I wish I had spent the money on a device instead of this app. But, I‚Äôm still using it and holding out hope that the developers make the necessary improvements. If they don‚Äôt, I‚Äôll be forced to buy the proper equipment.

Way better than specific built truck gps‚Äôs sold at truck stops. Gets you into and out of cities, towns, etc on the truck route. Will not route on roads that are not legal for a truck, will not route you under bridges that aren‚Äôt high enough for your rig. Full customization available for hazmat, over height, over weight etc. best of all, it‚Äôs on the phone,(or tablet), you already have! If you update your device, just re download it to your new device for free. If you have bad or absolutely no cell coverage... doesn‚Äôt matter, this works off of the gps system so it‚Äôll work anyway. Just like anything else, it isn‚Äôt perfect, I‚Äôve found obscure, and/or new roads that wasn‚Äôt noted in the system, (and they have a way to submit that so it‚Äôll be included in their next update), but 95 to 99 percent of the time, this gps will get you where you are going... legally. To many features to go through, but all are useful and rival what I used when I had a dedicated gps back in the day. SO GET IT ALREADY!!!
Even with a zip code and/or town name, I am unable to search for the Days Inn in Cabot, Arkansas. I am not happy that I paid for this service and would appreciate a refund.

label_title: From a very good Android app to slightly diminished capability apple app to SERIOUSLY
review: The only description I can give having used both fully paid and featured android app for both cars and enterprise which rightly held top spots to a placeholder app. My honest opinion is this has become for whatever reason a rock bottom effort to develop, create appearance of legitimacy by bare minimum cloud usage due to being necessary for obvious features, and seem to be in active development probably just to squeeze any last dollars before fading away. I used to switch from Copilot Android to the $99 Navigon (which also went bye bye) as they seemed to have dueling features with each update. Honestly this app has somehow reduced down to a GUI somewhere between a joke and cheap with paid add-ons that are either just unnecessary or free with every other decent free gps app. I can‚Äôt fault the dev because I certainly understand how any business with cash flow problems, rapid evolving competition, etc who initially invested real effort could want to make any last cent but boy this is a frustrating to use shadow of itself that should sell whatever technology rights they still can market and take a bath. Or bring back something resembling the original Copilot.
all my old settings from a previous version of copilot showed up in this new version based on my login credentials.  including voice-guided navigation and active traffic.

We used this on a cross country trip from Florida to Oregon and back towing a 37‚Äô fifth wheel trailer.
The downloadable maps are essential as there is sparse cell service in some areas of the country. The app worked well. 
Trip planning is very nice. There is a learning curve, but its not insurmountable. Also, the app sometimes did strange things when trying to change a route by dragging the calculated route. 
We used this on an ipad with a Dual XGPS150A receiver over Bluetooth connection. A very good setup indeed.
Note that this was an older version (early 2018) of the app.

I bought this app in April.  Used it once and the  could not get logged back in for 2 months.  I‚Äôm still having issues trying to get my email address updated and they keep telling me it‚Äôs my WiFi.  Sorry it‚Äôs not it‚Äôs the app.  So under impressed and the frustration is not worth it.

label_title: Won‚Äôt load my license on my phone
review: I purchased this app using my iPad and when I went to use it on my iPhone it‚Äôs asking me to buy another subscription. I like some aspects of the app although it has frozen a couple of times. Not sure why it will not load my license so I can use it from my phone. The company has no way to contact them when you go to their website and click contact us it just goes in endless loop of page refreshes with no actual email or phone number.
Will not let truck app part be downloaded. Just opens the app!

label_title: Glad it's finally been taken over by a map/GPS company!
review: We've been using CoPilot for several years now for a GPS while traveling in our RV - ever since Rand McNally abandoned their RV GPS app (we lost $99 on that one). When we bought CoPilot originally, it had several very nice features but when it was first sold off, the new owners (ALK?) unbundled many of the good features and we lost stuff we had already paid for. (Must have been taking lessons from the airlines.üòÜ)  Now that Trimble has taken over, our favorite features have returned and it looks like this is going to be a good iteration, as long as they don't get greedy. We give it 4 stars because we just got it and we're not sure how it will work in use but it looks good so far.

I installed this app when we recently purchased a Class A RV. The onboard navigation wasn‚Äôt cooperating, and I couldn‚Äôt figure out another app that had been recommended to us. CoPilot was easy to setup and guided us safely home.

label_title: Free version is no use at all
review: After trial period this app in basic form is useless.

I rarely use interstate highways on my RV. It is extremely difficult to exclude in this app. I can select avoid, but only for a few miles. I am planning a route of which Imam very familiar as a test route. Most everything is great, including offline maps. Would like elevation profile though.
Just too much trouble to exclude I75 from ATL to Orlando for example. I want to use 441 most of the way. WHY cannot I set a road as preferred!

label_title: Works great, matches trucking company routing software!!$$
review: People driving camper almost killed themselves. Your gps is not deadly! Lol

label_title: It is suggested to add Chinese language
review: First of all, I have to say that this App is great, but I think I need to add Chinese into the language options, because I am a Chinese, and now many Chinese compatriots drive trucks in the United States. They have to give up this App because they do not have Chinese prompts, so I strongly recommend adding Chinese language service, which is very helpful to you!

Have not tried garmin but waaaaaaayyyyyy better than rand mcripoffnally. Only issue I have is eta is based off current time zone that Apple device is set to. Figure that out and subtract/add hours to figure true eta. I‚Äôve had it run me down a non truck route in alabamy once. Other than that no problems and worth the cost. Dev seems to do regular updates. Could use crowd sourced ratings of truck stops/Wally worlds/ rest areas but it‚Äôs not a dealbreaker. Traffic updates are fairly reliable as are routes. Gj dood. It‚Äôs sad as can be that seemingly one guy can outperform rand McNally and all their billions of dollars. No joke!!!!

Es bueno me gu√≠a por donde es correcto evadiendo puentes bajos y calles estrechas aunq es l√≥gico hay lugares como Massachusetts donde es casi imposible manejar relajado x lo estrecho al girar en las calles esta aplicaci√≥n es muy buena el √∫nico problema que quisiera que reparen es que al llegar al destino no da la ubicaci√≥n correcta del lugar a veces el destino est√° al lado derecho y el gps te dice ala izquierda y ah√≠ ay veces no hay donde hacer U turn eso es lo √∫nico malo que encontr√© el resto todo bien
very nice navigation. Thank you for this app

I‚Äôve been trying to plan a trip for 2 days now, and still can‚Äôt get it to add the stops I want to make, it just goes to the final destination, and will only give me one route.  I had the older version of CoPilot and just loved it, but the new version is very hard to use, I‚Äôm probably going to delete it and find another app!

It saved me when T-Mobile had no service as usual in Upstate NY.
Very easy pleasant graphical interface. Good guidance. Option to choose from several different routes before driving. Accurate.
Sadly, Apple and Google not letting that company to be added into CarPlay nor Android Auto. Not sure, why would I need there WhatsApp in my CarPlay while I‚Äôm driving? 
I used another GPS navigation software SYGIC but it had weird routes and difficult to enter and find simple US address.
So, for now, Co-Pilot is the best

The application is not a great application. Not a clear way to enter a address as well as the application can not locate known addresss that are easily found in Google, MSN and Apple Maps. The application started out ok but stopped navigating after 10-15 minutes. But would just beep and kill all audio in the vehicle!
This is a swing and a major miss! I am uninstalling this worthless app! Would not use it even if free!

This app is designed for all circumstances with the safety of the daily driver, RV/Camper operator and Truckers in mind. With that being said at what point will the developer update the system for use with CarPlay?? I use CarPlay for every other reputable GPS platform for daily drivers. It‚Äôs this reason that I don‚Äôt make this app my #1 go-to for navigation. Please please please work with Apple so I can start using this app with my Apple CarPlay.
Very good GPS. Very helpful and easy to use. It takes me to where I want to go. It‚Äôs great for trucking

I like the maps being loaded on my device. Makes for super fast wrong/missed turn adjustments 
App froze on me 3 times in 5 uses -that needs fixed
Also at the end of destination image turns to asking a question- wrong time for this. Need to keep final destination up on screen as it can be problematic to find some houses or businesses

label_title: Can‚Äôt Log In or Create a New Account
review: IOS 12.2 and iPhone X. Can log in to website via Safari. App is problematic.

I bought this app along with lifetime navigation and lifetime maps. My motivation was I tow an RV and I wanted to have accurate ETA. Shortly after I installed this app, they pulled those features out and put them into a subscription-based app and no longer support the main reason I purchased this for. The App Store still shows those features are available. I reinstalled the app to see and they are still not available in this app.

Update: after contacting the developers I found that I did not lose my previous purchase as it appeared. I have checked several routes I travel both with my camper and without. CoPilot has performed better than using google maps! Google maps assumes I am in a car, CoPilot routes me on better roads for RV travel. In fact, comparing my known routes (google v. CoPilot), CoPilot was the only one who gave me reasonable travel directions. Google gave several back roads I know I can‚Äôt travel. 

The app it‚Äôs self is ok and getting better. 
I am very disappointed that I paid full price, over $60 last year for this app, and now it is being marketed as a free app with subscriptions. The subscriptions are significantly less expensive then when I purchased the app. I purchased the app for an RV and paid for one year of Active Traffic.... now this is less than half the price. 

ALK Tech really owes its customers something for purchasing at the original price. If nothing else they should give a second year of the service to the account. 
Also the customer service is very lacking. No where can I find a contact for the CoPilot service to ask these questions... only for the parent company that likely won‚Äôt lead anywhere.

If I could give it negative rating I would .  This guided us into a closed road with our 45 ft motor home and 25 ft trailer.   A very narrow rd.  There was also a rr track paralleling the rd and a few trains came along while we were trying to figure out what to do. Tried to back up into a rd that was crossing the track but it was uphill and we were blocking traffic as well as it would have left the trailer on the tracks if a train came along as there wasn‚Äôt a long distance and was onto the tracks as well.  There was a narrow driveway with a ditch on both sides ahead and only because my husband has experience with tractors with trailers was he able to back in and get us out of there.  If he had not been as experienced as he was we would have had to pay for a tow out of there, they would have had to unhook the trailer with the car and tow the motor home backwards then we would have had to have the trailer turned around and towed it back to the motor home to be hooked back up.  After we did get ourselves out of there the app kept trying to reroute us back at which time we turned it off and guessed our way out of the town and back to the interstate.  This took place because we relied on it to go from the campground we were at to the interstate.  I am on a trial for this app and nowhere can I find out how to opt out so before you start your trial period find out how to get out of it first.

You can‚Äôt do anything without upgrading. So what‚Äôs the point? Google maps does more and it‚Äôs a free app. I wanted to try this app while towing my 45‚Äô 5th wheel RV in hopes it would prevent us from driving in small areas or getting trapped in tight gas stations etc... but why would I pay almost $30 for the RV driver app if I have no clue th his app would even help?!? Don‚Äôt waste your time unless you just have money to throw away if it doesn‚Äôt work.

label_title: I don‚Äôt recommend dis app at all
review: I got the full year it‚Äôs only been 3 months with it now it‚Äôs charging me again to renew this is just stupid
Cant even find addresses how do you expect me to use this let along pay you. Uninstalled. Ill be using sygic

This really needs a satellite imagery view, mainly for adding stops so I can see where the gps is trying to take me! I have to look at google to be sure this is sending me to the right place.

The other option needed is for the trucker portion, add an option to prioritize interstates, I‚Äôm sick of trying all these shortcuts through town because the gps thinks it‚Äôs shorter.. it ends up taking more time!

The big advantage of CoPilot is that it is always working. Too often I find that I lose the audio on my Apple Maps, or I‚Äôve lost my data connection using Google maps. CoPilot has maps built-in, so they‚Äôre always ready to go. My only complaint is that sometimes they‚Äôre not as accurate as Google, but that‚Äôs a problem for Apple Maps as well.

I‚Äôve liked and used this app for 5or6 years on both Android & Apple platforms. As a customer that already paid for a product with RV support - (3 times...between both platforms and my wife‚Äôs android tablet) - I feel that is it very deceptive to remove features so you can start charging a subscription.

Old customers should be grandfathered in and the new model should only apply to new customers.

Otherwise it‚Äôs a big ‚Äúscrew you‚Äù to the customers that helped get you here.

I won‚Äôt be subscribing. It‚Äôs unfortunate because it has been a favorite app for me for a long time.

I‚Äôm a capitalist and I have no problem with copilot finding alternate revenue streams. 

But removing a feature just so you can sell it back to the customer is the worst way to increase revenue. 

This kind of business practice makes it impossible to recommend to people.

If they did it to RV feature they can do it to every feature.

It‚Äôs a shame.

label_title: Support for product line Leaves much to be desired.
review:
I purchased Copilot RV in 2018. It proved initially useful, but halfway through my trip, my App was replaced without notice by CoPilot GPS.  The latter is an inferior product. The company stopped support for the former version that rhey discounted, knowing full well that they would no longer support it. Great business ethics on the part of CoPilot.

I replaced Copilots RV/GPS  with a standalone GPS from Garmin.

Apple has been unresponsive in refunding my money.  Is buying apps for an iPhone foolish?

label_title: Features I purchased have been switched to premium.
review: I bought this app several years ago and it worked fine. I didn‚Äôt need or want voice navigation. Recently they bundled voice navigation with ordinary directions into a premium package. Now I can‚Äôt even search for a destination or get directions, unless I cough up more money. Extortion. Presumably they want a subscription, which makes Apple more money.
After months of saying it was in the works, it‚Äôs still not here. Until then I won‚Äôt use copilot.

label_title: POI‚ÄôS on route when planning a trip
review:
Would be helpful if when looking at your map route to Be able to see POI‚ÄôS so be able to plan parking, fuel ect..

Truck stop icons need to be separate icon per truck stops so can tell what truck stop it is by just glancing at map, example pilot icon identifies pilot ect..
Its to hard to tell what it is when all icons look the same

Can no longer even search without paying.  Completely worthless.  Online app identifies as offline app.  RV profile removed.  App deletes your purchases.  We don‚Äôt do subscriptions.  Disappointed, long time user.
Where's the Canada maps? Shows a picture of US/Canada flags, but only offers US maps for download.
Needs to be fixed

I want the choice to stay off highways and/or toll. This doesn‚Äôt easily allow this feature. Says you can however I‚Äôve not found that true. It is good for POINTS OF INTEREST but so are others. I would also like alternative routes which again, if this is offered, I‚Äôve yet to find it. So I will still use Maps, Waze, and MyScenicDrive.

I‚Äôve been using this app and paying for a monthly subscription for about four months now. All of a sudden today, it says Copilot failed to find valid route to my destination. It will not even find a route to the truck stop right down the street.

This was a GREAT app before the update. Now it freezeeeeeezsz. Additionally, I purchased this program as it had a vehicle selection that included motorhomes. It had different road speeds, height, bridges etc but with the "new improved version", it's all gone. Looks like to me that they are forcing me to upgrade to the RV & trucker version. I held up on the update thinking I would be going to and annual fee and I'm sure I'm not the only one. Otherwise it's the same Copilot Truck I've been using for years and it's still the best.
Just like every other ‚Äútruck gps ‚Äú app it takes you down streets you shouldn‚Äôt be on. It routes you out of your way most of the time. Just stick with google maps and plan ahead.

Started my trial today.  Three observations that I have made so far.  Two are a deal breaker.  First the voice is computer generated and not natural voice so it gets on everyone‚Äôs nerves so bad we can hardly use it.   Also I need a trailer towing section to add dimensions and weight of my towing.  Other than that, I will continue the trial and update this if I find anything else.  The non deal breaker was that I didn‚Äôt get to pick an icon to place on the road during navigation.

label_title: A good app, but terrible support!
review:
I‚Äôve been using the app for about a year and it has never issued a bad instruction. It‚Äôs multiple route to choose from and the traffic features are a real winners.

The problem comes when you try to reach someone at the developer for tech support. They are slow to respond, don‚Äôt answer your question and leave you high and dry.

My subscription is still with in the one year I paid for, but the app is back to basic mode and asking me to pay again. A simply fix for them, your thinks, but no. It‚Äôs been 3 days and now the weekend is here and I have no option but to repurchase something for which I‚Äôve already paid. 

I rely on this app to assist me in safely and reliably doing my job and have communicated that to them, but have been ignored. So buy this app with the knowledge that you may be on your own.

Today I paid for the whole year for $69.99 but I was charged $76.46 and another charge of $17.45!! I want a full refund because the routing is terrible on this app. I don‚Äôt know why I was overcharged
I downloaded his app because it said it‚Äôs also for RV NAVIGATION...but it‚Äôs not an option!

label_title: Was my favorite but not anymore
review:

Boo to the greedy developers!!!!!
Seems to be loaded and working.

label_title: App still has a long ways to go
review:
App still has a long ways to go

Downloaded the RV app as we need an app that will help keep us out of trouble while on the road. I have a 2016 Chevy LTZ 2500 that we pull a 5th wheel with. 
Downloaded the app and set it up, and first time out, and very disappointed. If you have your phone plugged in the USB port on your vehicle, to charge your phone, or so as I do use it so I can talk into truck speakers and mic pickup, play podcasts, use wifi and everyday operations in the truck, the speed display on the App will be about exactly 1/2 of actual speed. So time to the destination is wrong, turn time and distance is wrong.more seriously the warnings one would expect to get, traffic issues etc will NOT function properly.

I asked for a refund and discuss this issue with a person and was sent a new link to a new support ticket that takes you to a site only to reregister. 

If you plan on charging your phone, talk on it, use your phone while plugged in to your vehicles then don‚Äôt buy it. It could be serious dangerous. Too bad CoPilot! And you should disclose the issue

Here‚Äôs there answer: The conflict of speed limit displaying in CoPilot can be caused by the cable USB connection to the truck. You need to unplug the cable in order to have CoPilot displaying the correct speed.

Unfortunately, the issue you are experiencing is linked to the cable connector not compatible with CoPilot which we do not support.

If you have further questions, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Regards,

Rachid
CoPilot Consumer Support

It will get you last here some example
7809 BEAR MOUNTAIN BLVD
Bakersfield, ca
2555 East Olympic blv
Los Angeles , ca

label_title: Low bridges/ speed limit/ location of addresses
review:
I have wanted an app like this for a long time. My job requires me to drive around at 14‚Äô8‚Äù. I gave this app a try, and I will not be purchasing the full version. However, if they would like my input I would continue to work with the developers for free.

1. I almost hit around 6 or 7 low bridges throughout the iron range of upper Minnesota, Wisconsin, and Michigan. The app did not have them marked. Thank god the state did, clearly a 14‚Äô2‚Äù bridge. Which litters all of us hwy 2 and us hwy 41. I would be as bold to say that most the bridges in the UP are 14‚Äô6‚Äù or lower at least. I was so busy I didn‚Äôt get a chance to flag them all. They should look into it. 

2. The locations of where I was going were off by at least ten miles. I had to use google maps to get there.

3. Speed limits are off. It beeped at me for 30 miles of 55mph. The app has it as a 45mph. This was before I learned about the accucheck however so I didn‚Äôt get a chance to flag it.

The one good thing is: so far I believe it‚Äôs truck routes to be accurate at least. I was never on a weight restricted road. 

After all is said is done, I would be open to helping the developers improve the app for free, but at this point there is no way I would pay money for an app that is basically a less accurate version of google maps. 

Please improve low bridge feature for sure. Anything under 16‚Äô.

label_title: Really? No GPS on iPad using iPhone as Hotspot
review:
Apple Maps works...
Google Maps works...
But, a paid Map App can‚Äôt figure it out.
1 Star for a 14 Day trial. Time enough to delete.

i meant imagine ran McNally 99.9% accurate and this one 95% accurate but you have it on your iPhone and your iPad which makes it better for me and something else more updates would be nice specially for the iPad 11 inch

very good offline GPS, nice interface and accurate maps. could use some freshening up on visuals and must become carplay compatible

label_title: I‚Äôm really frustrated with this app right this minute!
review: Why can‚Äôt I zoom out! I need to see if there is any parking at the spot I‚Äôm going to. And why is there no satellite view. This app could be great if it had these abilities. I need to know if bridges are low for my RV. I think I‚Äôm going to cancel this app. Way to hard to figure out! I need a beer now!

label_title: THE GPS THAT IS ALWAYS THERE
review: The maps are OFFLINE, so, unlike Apple or Google, the navigation does NOT need an online connection! This feature allows copilot to navigate even under severe weather conditions. Best GPS--ever!

label_title: Not bad, but room for improvement

I would also love to see CarPlay integration, which would help on solo trips, so I am not fumbling with my phone or iPad.
