Just like the title, I‚Äôll update soon as they slip lol, I hate you can‚Äôt buy the subscription like before, since paying yearly they better be on their A-game

I have been using this all for many years, locally, in rental cars (big $$ saver). Best app purchase I‚Äôve ever made hands down. I even use this over my installed navigation system, it‚Äôs more accurate.
You need to update your maps
I can‚Äôt access truck profiles anymore well I never could with the new App can you all please help me

The Ap appears to be free. After taking a full 24 hours to download, and using all of my WiFi data, it opens with the option to continue with your 14 day free trial or buy the Ap!  I didn‚Äôt even look at the price, just immediately deleted.

This app is missing lots of data. The aa few roads with speed limits and what they have is out of date. I can‚Äôt find many addresses and what they do find is off by hundreds of feet. 
Needs lots of work, better data, more recent data, better accuracy... and more. Maybe a few revisions from now it will be ok to use. Not ready for primary use at this point.
Please optimize for iPhone Max

OMG, how freaking long does it take to download a map? Trying to download Eastern US and it has been 24 hours and only 51% complete. Sitting on my home Wi-Fi and downloading is terrible. Ridiculous how slow the download is. Not worth the wait.

label_title: Won‚Äôt do anything unless you create an account
review:
I don‚Äôt like apps that won‚Äôt f######g do anything until you spend time giving away your personal information. I like to take them out for a spin first. This app insists on making me sign in.
DELETED.

The ONE thing that I like about this app is that I can still use it when I‚Äôm offline and/or out of cell range, but that‚Äôs the ONLY thing I like about it.

It will rarely find businesses nearby when I search for one. I cannot figure out how to display an address from my favorites. Once it‚Äôs in there, I can‚Äôt find a way to see it again! Editing doesn‚Äôt even show it and when I arrive at a destination, I sometimes need to see the address to know which building!

It‚Äôs really hard to find features I need (if they even exist on this app) such as finding an alternate route to get around a road closure, and  I haven‚Äôt figured out how to show a route starting from any location other than where I am at the moment.

It‚Äôs an incredibly frustrating app to use!
Yo he usado copilot truck desde hace 19 a√±os y estoy muy contento con el programa es muy bueno 100% lo recomiendo

I have used and bragged about copilot to my friends for years. However, this recent up grade is terrible.  Not only was I forced to upgrade just when I needed to use the app off line, the conversion was complex and I had to re-enter all of my favorites individually as they would not transfer over.  Then, and only then, did to learn that the find feature to access my favorites and other items is now a ‚Äúpremium‚Äù.  Such a basic function now with the premium cost. Ugggg.  

Now, just went to upgrade, so I could use the search feature. Only upgrade includes online access. The best feature of copilot was being able to navigate off-line.  If I wanted to be online and burning through data why use this when Google maps and other online services are available.  I think I‚Äôm done with copilot. Very sad.

label_title: Seems to do a good job.
review: Time will tell how good it is once I start touring the country on the bike this summer. But I‚Äôm impressed so far. It is certainly better than those from some of the big name companies.
If you like good customer service buy a store bought gps. This company is joke and doesn‚Äôt care after you‚Äôve given them your business.

label_title: When it's working 100% I love it.
review:
I've only had small annoyances with the app; tech support was slow and we're not able to resolve either issue.

The first issue was my location marker was the size of dime. I did a from scratch rebuild on the iPad and that resolved it.

The second issue was current, active traffic has not worked for around a year.

Today I installed the new app,, transferred the settings and I had 12 days left on active traffic.

I paid the $9.99 for another year to save the trouble of getting them to take action.

At first.the app was buggy as heck but it's pretty good now.

Outside of slow and In infective tech support I like the app.

However, I am currently not purchase the trucking add on.... So I guess I'll go without it.

I use google maps for active traffic and backup routing. I guess I could just use google but there are features I don't want to go with out.

I've been using the app for several years.
Why is the app not working I cannot put it in truck mode it only going in car
The app sometimes takes you down restricted routes... just look at your atlas and see before you head out .... with a few updates it will be great

This app is way too complicated. I bought it years ago and loved it, but I guess they decided to make confusing adjustments that not even a cartographer could understand. I wouldn‚Äôt throw away my money on this.

label_title: RV owners beware. This app now a ripoff
review: I‚Äôve been using this app with an RV profile for over three years. It has kept me and my RV safe. Their latest update is a disaster. No RV profile.  No longer can you trust this app.  Instead the shameless developers have opted to make me buy the truck app. Very unfortunate.

label_title: Would be good but no Apple Car Play
review: It is a good navigation system especially when there is no cell service but the subscription service is expensive when Google and Waze gives it free and there is not Apple Car Play which means I rarely use it.
It‚Äôs perfect app I using it every day but I can‚Äôt see speed limit streets , if it‚Äôs possible please tell me how customizable it thanx

What a rip off. June 16, 2018 I purchased CoPilot through the Apple App Store, in January 2019 I‚Äôm informed that the version I purchased was being retired! And, to login or go to the App Store to obtain the replacement App. I was unsuccessful when attempting to login and submitted my email to have my password reset, that was three days ago, still waiting. Since I‚Äôm leaving with my RV, & couldn‚Äôt wait any longer, I went to the App Store to obtain the replacement app (CoPilot GPS). I downloaded the app, no charge along with the North America Maps. After setting up the App for the particulars for my RV I‚Äôm informed that I have a 14 day trial period before having to pay for the App. Again what a rip off - I cannot recommend this app.

label_title: Missing Copy/Paste and Proper iOS Integration
review:
I use lengthy, randomly-generated passwords for all of my ‚ÄúInternet accounts‚Äù, and use a password manager to store them. 

Logging into this app is a PITA, because the developers have not properly implemented a basic copy and paste functionality. They also aren‚Äôt using current-generation iOS integration that seamlessly makes password manager functions available to the app. 

To the developers:
1) implement copy and paste. 
2) update your app to take advantage of current-generation iOS features.
I paid $50 for their RV specific app and they then killed it and no refund!

label_title: Still only had yelp to search
review: It‚Äôs a good thing no one ever wants to search for anything other than restaurants. Looking for a place? No simple google search, you better hope it‚Äôs on yelp, because that‚Äôs all the ‚Äúsearch online‚Äù so-called feature lets you do. And you better already know what city it‚Äôs in, or you can‚Äôt find it anyway, because you can‚Äôt do a search without first putting in the city you want to search in. It‚Äôs just stupid.
Wasted time inputting my RV info and then found it was impossible to search on the very first address I tried, a popular RV resort, to plan a trip.

Upgraded app completely broken. Unable to open app on any device signed into my account. This happens every time app developer overhauls their app lineup. After YEARS of trial and error you would hope developer would learn not to use us as a staging platform.

Active Traffic used to indicate traffic conditions on the next 100 miles.  Noticed during my holiday travels that the app now only shows traffic conditions for 60 miles.  This degradation is not helpful for my trips along the I-95 corridor.  Please restore the 100 mile traffic bar.
Instead of updating the app you made a new one and forced us to repurchase the new one

Let‚Äôs face it most of the time we are all using Google Maps or Apple Maps via Siri for navigation. Siri is automatic and Google maps very easy to use. I have this App because I don‚Äôt always have data available overseas especially. However I find the App completely non intuitive and sometimes downright hostile.

Been using Copilot for 5+ years and just a week ago it suddenly stopped working. When I open the app it tells me I need to upgrade ($15/yr!) and it won‚Äôt let me access my favorites or even set a route anywhere.

I‚Äôve been using this app for years to help route my day out. Never used it for navigating so I can‚Äôt speak on that. Now you need to pay for premium service to even look up an address. I will be uninstalling and using my garmin from now on. It‚Äôs too bad. They had a good thing going

I‚Äôm so sad about this app right now. I‚Äôve been using CoPilot for 5 years now. I‚Äôve loved that it‚Äôs free and does not use my data at all. Well a couple days ago, I fire this app up and it‚Äôs telling me I have to use the ‚Äúbasic features‚Äù and that to even use the app I have to ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù. Absolutely just crushed, what was completely free and such a breeze and made routing my days so simple and amazing...overnight they flip it completely and now I can no longer use this. Such a shame. This was one of my favorite and most used apps for work. You messed up CoPilot, you messed up.

label_title: So far severely flawed - positive update
review:
Update 12/22/2108

Customer support was really helpful and the situation of not finding my home address has been resolved by downloading another correct map.

Looks good now, I just need to get back to the States end of January to take it on a test ride.
________________________

Trying to get started with the new app I couldn‚Äôt even enter my home address. It would not find it (it is simple and found by any other app).

It doesn‚Äôt even find my hometown Charlotte, NC - a 1.5 million metro and the biggest city in North Carolina. What‚Äôs up with that?

Also positioning the cursor by pressing down on the keyboard on my iPhone 7 does not work.

The app still needs quite some improvement.

label_title: Latest update breaks RV functions, deletes paid features
review:
This company has lost my trust. I was happy to pay for a premium subscription to this app which was admittedly cheaper than it could‚Äôve been, but on the latest update they deleted critical features, apparently moving them to a MUCH more expensive optional subscription. And I found out the hard way when the app tried to take me under a low underpass that the prior version would‚Äôve avoided. 

I‚Äôm very upset that my prior purchase is rendered worthless. If they did that once before, why should I trust them again? Beware that if you pay for an annual subscription this company, you may not get what you pay for.

I‚Äôve used CoPilot GPS for years and had my routing profiles set up and ActiveTraffic subscription set.  I‚Äôve submitted a number of map updates along the way.  The latest update deleted my custom routing profiles and now I can‚Äôt recreate them because the RV option was removed and forced into a subscription, apparently. 

As soon as my ActiveTraffic is up, I‚Äôm done with CoPilot. The only thing holding me right now is everything is still in tact on my Android device. 

Pity, it was such a good product.
Great app but really needs Carplay support.  I find that I am using other map programs more due to the integration.

label_title: Longtime Copilot user - mostly good, but a few deficiencies
review:
Originally bought Copilot 10 years ago for my iPhone 3G.  Regular updates of have been decent, but I have 4 complaints (minus 1/2 star for each)

1) The voice doesn‚Äôt speak everything you would like to know which is super annoying and forces your to look at the screen, which is fine if you are a passenger, but not so if you are driving.   Instead of saying, ‚ÄúIn two miles, exit right on 247 B‚Äù like it should, it will only say ‚ÄúIn two miles, exit right.‚Äù

2) While having an active destination being routed, you cannot zoom out, and have bird‚Äôs eye view of your route.  I tried in both 2D and 3D views and neither would function. 

3) No Apple Watch integration... would love to be tapped on my wrist when my turn approaches

4) no CarPlay integration

BEWARE: The latest update  has removed the RV Profile.  I am not sure if they have put it in a premium addition but I can no longer find it in the update or as an in-app purchase.  I‚Äôve been using Copilot for several years and it has always been my goto app especially when I get lost.  That being said, use with extreme care, as you should with all navigation devices.  For the majority off the time Copilot has been very good throughout Canada and the US as I travel very extensively. However, I once let my guard down and nearly ran out of gas a long way from any town.  The discovery was made when it routed me to a graveled forest service road.  It was 60 miles to get back on track and to the nearest gas station.  Check other resources and question the choices made by Copilot.  It makes mistakes too and when it can be a life or death situation use extra caution when vectored through less traveled routes.  Still, it has been a valuable app and has helped me many times, especially being in the proper lane for an exit.  I still recommend it and with the voice directions.  I do not recommend the Apple TTS voice as that will drive you insane with annoyance as it reads every little detail.  I go with Lisa.  I removed a star because the dropped the RV profile.  Also the information for this app is incorrect as it still includes RV specs not found in the app.  This is misleading.  I tested the update on an older device and will not be upgrading on my new devices because I use the RV profile for highway speed and preferences.  Don‚Äôt trust height or propane as the premium RV customers warn in their reviews.

label_title: Rubbish they just want money, when will you pillage and r***e me ?
review:
Zero stars, I prefer to use my in car nav system rather than this . 

Latest update asks you to buy voice guided navigation , erm this is used in car what point is a mute read only navigation. 

This is now a very poor company with even worse help. 

NO I AM NOT USING TRIAL VERSION 
Repeat I AM NOT USING TRIAL VERSION please repeat after me !! Rather than sending stupid replies , really makes one wonder who you are and if you listen to paying customers ! 

please do not make assumptions 

I DONT WANT TO KEEP GIVING YOU MONEY FOR AN APP I HAVE PAID FOR !! This is a poor business plan , the golden goose cannot be milked continuously !!

label_title: No more RV support in northeast
review: What the heck happened?  An update is supposed to be better not worse. I paid for this app because it helped with towing RV. Now it‚Äôs useless because ‚Äúit‚Äôs not supported‚Äù anymore.

label_title: You removed the RV Profile in version 10.10.0.535
review: I have been using this app for several years and the latest version has now rendered it useless.  I assume it is to force those of us using the app for RV navigation to buy the more expensive version.  I will be shopping for a navigation app, but will be looking at competitors since ALK Technologies has cast me and a number of others adrift.  This is quite the topic on the RV forums and many are as upset as I am.

I‚Äôve been using CoPilot since 1998. Awesome program.  Looking forward to seeing a CarPlay version.  Cellphone coverage isn‚Äôt that great in my area and to have offline maps would be a huge blessing.

This most recent update deleted all my RV settings and no longer show an RV as a vehicle option. WTH? I‚Äôve been using and recommending this app for over 8 years and you just killed it. After spending money on the premium version, I now am expected to purchase an RV version for another $40. Way to treat current customers. You should at least offer an upgrade at a discount for current users.
Seems to be missing places that I can find on MyDrive by TomTom.  Missing major roads headed to my work from my house.

label_title: I paid for this and I regret it
review: Apple support did not help me to get my money back. Don't download this app it is an ugly app with lot of problems. Download "here we go" is free and has a lot lot more functions. I am dissappointed with Apple also. This was my first and last Apple product I ever buy. (Iphone xs max)

label_title: Slow and no auto recalculate when off route
review: Nice to have maps off line.  When using it the blip showing location is always behind that of my current location.  If I get off route it does not recalculate a new route.   Likes me to turn around and go back many times ( thou I know there are other ways).  Was thinking of upgrading to RV app but if it can not provide simple routing in a car what good is going to be when towing a travel trailer.

label_title: The only gps app I use
review: You want be dissatisfied with this app, it‚Äôs never let me down. and the best part  maps are stored on your phone.

We have used this App for at least five years, possibly more, and could always depend on it.  We just completed a 14,000 mile trip back and forth across the US.  Initially we noticed more problems with routing, even being directed under a 10‚Äô bridge with our 13‚Äô RV.  That was something that had never happened before, and we had always trusted the App.  The road mapping just didn‚Äôt seem to be working as well, and we were happy to see a required update with new maps come out.  As instructed by ALK Tech we updated the app, removed the old maps and installed new.  WE CAN NO LONGER TRUST THIS APP.  We were incorrectly directed onto bridges that do not allow vehicles over 24‚Äô in length, that were too low, onto roads that don‚Äôt allow vehicles of our size, onto off ramps on freeways, only to be directed right back on to the same freeway, and to incorrect locations.  Everything we could trust before, cannot be trusted any longer.  Our account seems to have been downgraded to a Demo account, although we actually had a Premium account before the upgrade, and I cannot get any help from the tech team.  DO NOT INVEST IN THIS APP - until you start seeing better reviews come through.  It is inconvenient at best, with all the mistakes in routing, and very dangerous at the worst with the risk you run of being put into a bad situation with a long, tall RV.

label_title: Great For Offline GPS car navigation
review: I was reviewing gps apps and this one so far seems the best. It is fast and reliable in its navigation.  I would much rather use offline gps apps like copilot since they do not rely on cell signal which are not available everywhere and why use cell data if u dont need to.  The traffic feature does use cell data but only a little and u can turn that off if u want when going overseas etc. i like also that u can download certain areas of the usa or europe maps which saves space.
Works great on a windows phone but not very user friendly on an iPhone

label_title: Like it overall but some issues - updated update 2 dangerous app.
review:
Finally used this for a few thousand mile trip and can definitely state that it is dangerous. Had the profile set to RV and 13 foot high. It guided me off the main route to my destination, then navigated to a narrow lane through the woods to get back to the main road. I managed to avoid this disaster by making a K-turn and going back to the main road, then drove past the ‚Äúroad‚Äù it had wanted me to take. It didn‚Äôt exist. Somewhere between where it wanted me to turn and the intersection with the main road, it dead ended. Had I taken it I would have had to try to back my 35 foot trailer nearly a mile, assuming I didn‚Äôt get stuck in a muddy rut. DO NOT USE THIS APP!!!

Pros - can add RV height to the vehicle to avoid low bridges (really a great help); can create and store trips for future use; maps can be loaded in sections to conserve space - maps are used offline.
Update - in traveling with our RV, we like to avoid interstate highways. Most gps apps and devices have an option to avoid highways. If selected, you end up with ridiculous routes sometimes hundreds of miles out of the way. This app provides a selection of options where you can select how strongly you want to avoid highways. Then it routes on interstates only where it makes sense. Good feature that should be in all navigation devices/apps,

Neutral - provides lane guidance that has become standard; options for routing includes standard avoidances including dirt roads.
Update - the lane guidance is definitely behind the state of the art and desperately needs updated. 
While the map information does not need any internet, traffic conditions (available via paid subscription) does require internet.

Cons - no way to get speech working with Chrysler Uconnect if also using hands free phone; graphics for lane guidance pretty poor; speed limit info seems very limited; traffic info requires yearly subscription;
Update:
Speed  limit display :unlike every other nav device and app, speed limits are only available for interstates, rendering it mostly useless.
Routing: Seems to route through the middle of towns and ignores bypasses when not on an interstate. Very irritating with an RV. 
POIs: basically totally useless. Most are flat wrong. Indicating gas or food where there are only fields.
Text to speech on Apple- this is terrible. There is one voice that cannot be heard over normal road noise that does text to speech. Other voices have great volume but are irritatingly generic with statements like - exit in 2 miles. You have to look at the screen to see what the exit is called.

Update overall: not clear that the serious problems out weigh the advantages. Still searching for a really good navigation app but this definitely isn‚Äôt it.

The speed limit alert does not show, even after I set it up in settings.  If this worked, it would be good.
Reported this a couple times already, but still not fixed.  2 Nov 2018.

label_title: Good mapping but search if not good
review: The big problem I have found for an RVer is no searching from state and national parks. The way around is to search address in another app then make it a contact then I can map it. It would also be nice to be able to put a stop in the trip.

label_title: This app is awful!! DO NOT BUY THE NEW VERSION!!
review:
I originally bought CoPilot a few years ago to use while driving through Italy. It was a dream -it enabled me to falling back roads, drive without using cellular data and gave crisp voice directions which guided me through town by town.

Unfortunately, this new version is unusable. When I bought the new version for Spain and Portugal I found that the cost was $25, because I could not purchase a single country map. The new version is inaccurate (the red dot indicating where you are is constantly humongous around and almost caused a number of accidents as I swerved to take an exit at the last second). It does not contain Voice (unless you pay an additional $18) and is impossible to figure out. I am usually very good with technical matters, but this one continually eludes me. Simply said, I hate it! The old version was terrific and this one is worse than asking a two-year-old child for directions.

This gps often shows incorrect street signs, or exit names. I often missed my exit off the expressway because the gps showed something different than what I was looking at in real life. It was very frustrating. It‚Äôs just not as accurate and up to date as more popular gps‚Äôs. I also didnt like that there wasn‚Äôt an option to pause your music or podcast while the turn-by-turn voice spoke. Other gps will do that and this one wont. I also found that it will sometimes randomly redirect you even if you were on the path it told you to be on. It‚Äôs just not a great app. I wanted something different than apple maps, but this app is only different in negative ways.

label_title: A great Navigation app try it!
review: This is a great innovative flexible and easy to use navi app you don‚Äôt need to use your data connection but recommends to turn better accuracy which helps it coordinate but it‚Äôs not always accurate with directions but a lot of navi apps have them issues as well. One problem I noticed is when you want to search for a business or like a location it may not show up in search. But seems to be getting even better over the years. So for the price of $10 for voice turn instructions and the functionality and reliably I would recommend this app as current version!
Anytime I need direction , cell service or not it never lets me down.

The team should be congratulated for their effort. This is a great app. Two things come to mind that make me a fan. The Maps are resident on your phone, so if you travel to an area (like mountains) with no cell service you don‚Äôt have anxiety about if you phone will have all the data it needs to properly navigate. The other is the traffic bar, you can ‚Äúsee‚Äù out 100 miles and know what‚Äôs coming.
I‚Äôve found this app to be very easy to use, intuitive and clearly designed to fit the users needs!

The majority of the time this app works really well. There have been a few times where it‚Äôll say take a left, but when you look at the screen it has you taking a right. When this happened the screen was correct.  Not the verbal directions.
There is a one-way street in my neighborhood, and the app always has me going down the one-way street in the wrong direction.

This app is so much more flexible than the other gps apps I‚Äôve used!  I love that I can control the look of the app, set my preferences, easily change routes,etc. HOWEVER, I don‚Äôt like that the routing instructions are frequently wrong and sometimes even dangerous!  Yesterday in Philadelphia, it told me to take several turns that were the wrong way on one way streets. Then it tried to get me to drive past my exit, go a mile, make a u-turn and go back to my exit!  When I ignored it and just took my exit, it kept trying to route me back until I got 10 miles up the road - then it gave up. I am using the latest version of the app and the latest update of the maps.  In summary, love the app most of the time but very frustrated with some of the routing instructions.

I upgraded to this version on 7 October 2018

Since then I have had a number of issues with the program and basically it is not functioning for me .
In this version, CoPilot is unable to find any route to any destination.
I have contacted CoPilot to report this as a problem, but would suggest that new uses might want to wait a few days to see if this issue gets fixed

So, my data is unpaid. This means I would need a offline GPS. This is not as good as Waze or Gmaps, but those require internet connection. My only concerns is that for it to show accurate info is to reload or click the arrow. Though, this is the best of offline GPS apps. Highly recommend!

First insist I install the new version as opposed to upgrading the old one. Second, lose my favorites that I cannot replace without driving several hours because they were not findable street addresses. Third, offer me the same clunky interface I had before the upgrade!

label_title: Best GPS out there for the price!
review: I drive a truck and have used copilot for trucks exclusively for over 5 years starting back when it first came out as a laptop program. Won‚Äôt use anything else! It‚Äôs perfect!

I lost every piece of information and addresses from years of using this. I should not have had to reinstall all of the information back into the app. I don‚Äôt appreciate it. It should‚Äôve been able to be transferred to this new app that I have no idea what the changes are and if it‚Äôs going to work as the prior app. Next time please make it where information could be transferred to a new app

I am a original user of CoPilot, love the app, it was excellent in Europe as well, especially appraising of traffic camera traps.  Anyhow I had CoPilot HD, was wondering why iPhone X support was lacking for a year now.  I was just notified to move to this current CoPilot GPS which now supports the X phone, yeah!  Two issues, one was exporting all contacts from the old HD app to CoPilot cloud then importing them into this new app, it didn't import them.  Second issue is the voice, it should use Apple TTS but the voice is not Siri like, it's a low toned male-ish terrible robot voice, yuk!  What's with that?!?  Will the downloaded Copilot voices do full TTS?  I don't think so.

label_title: App is fine, dev support is another story
review: App works fine but developer is slow to update software. Can go over a year without any updates. They never updated the software to correct app scaling on a iPhone X display, they finally fixed it after iOS12 release. iOS12 was announced in June and now has support for third party Nav apps in CarPlay. Developer didn‚Äôt make a statement until sept 27th that they are now ‚Äúlooking‚Äù into it while other companies already have CarPlay compatible apps out, like google maps, or going through Apple Review right now, like Sygic. Developer is lagging behind other solutions.

I have been using CoPilot now for over three years, possibly one of the best GPS phone based navigation apps I have ever used. The new update has made me second-guess the app, the new voice sounds like a speak and spell.
They to improve the TTS output.
Not working properly, need money back
I need more settings how to setup for truck and trailer 14,2 feet‚Äôs!
It uses yelp for search. How can anyone move from google to yelp as a search engine. So pathetic that i see my money wasted.

I consider Garmin king Google is a distant second and after that There are several that I tried which vary in shortcomings.  

I took aa trip through the mountains in western Virginia and copilot lost its way on numerous times.  I did the rest of that trip with Google.

I downloaded Copilot and bought a live traffic subscription. In a week, the app led me to 2 places incorrectly. On the overview map the route looks correct but the details are not.  It is also difficult to enter a destination. Don't bother with Copilot. Waze is cheaper and actually works.

Thank you for being my ‚ÄúCo Pilot‚Äù I arrived home safely. And 
thank you for offering you service for free and offline.

CoPilot used to be my default nav app. Due to nothing but headaches with activations on new phones, I moved to Apple Maps. 

While Apple Maps keeps improving, CoPilot seems to have gotten worst. I'm trying to get ready for a multi stop 2 week trip through Italy. I've been at it for 4 hours now and have managed to enter a grand total of 3 addresses. On one occasion it could not locate the street but had the hotel as a poi. BUT, it can't navigate to a POI. 

I haven't paid anything for the app. Seems first map comes free. But, it's either crippled intentionally (they could say so). Or the app is very weak. Again, 4 hours to enter 3 addresses so far. I'm not paying for this without any idea of what I get. Especially since I already paid for all of Europe but can't get it activated. It used to access Contacts but that option no longer appears in the menu list. Manually is a horrible experience.  

Going back to Apple Maps. Will buy a data package at the airport.
No star. Purchased North America and Europe maps, it's buggy, worthless with ads and hard to use. I deleted it to save storage and and use instead the free much better produc 'here' app.

label_title: Unable to see map I paid $25 for...
review:
Bought the map of Brazil, downloaded, nothing shows on country. Rebooted app multiple times, nothing.

Frustrating and not so user friendly.

Will need assistance to make this work.

Not happy with the program. I subscribed to real-time traffic etc. but have yet to see anything about it. I have come upon a couple of incidents, but the program did not advise me.

I input a couple of construction hazards but three days later, they still don‚Äôt show up 

Asking for a refund
Nice gps app in general but without a gpx (or other) import feature it‚Äôs absolutely useless to me.

label_title: Speed limit not working in US maps
review:
Speed limit is not working in the US map. 
One more suggestion, the next destination should be shown on Top

I would give Copilot a 5 if you could coordinate trips across devises. I use my iPhone 7+ and my iPad Air. It would be nice if my Favorites were on both without having to add them to each.

Update: Still no coordination across my devises for Favorite trips. Also why are Premium Features not honored across devices. I.E.: iPhone and iPad.

label_title: This might beat google by its functionality.
review: All it needs a quick start when u touch the icon and its agoogle map.

I like the complete UI, the endless features and it‚Äôs dependable navigation; that is, if I‚Äôm using it visually!! ‚òπÔ∏è It doesn‚Äôt suit me much nonetheless though, as I do not get any Spoken TTS when my radio is playing; only works TTS in AUX mode!! I am still hoping that my Ticket submitted in this regard is answered professionally and my issue can be resolved!! I‚Äôm I the only person experiencing this problem!! ü§®

Review Update!!!! 
  A big thanks to the CoPilot team for actually responding to my ‚Äòreview‚Äô!! I am looking forward to their next update in the hopes that my one ‚Äòbig‚Äô issue can be resolved!!! Should this happen...I will give the best updated review in BiG Bold Letters!!! üëåüèª

label_title: Not for RV even though it has RV profile
review: I was told this app can be used for RV‚Äôs and has an RV profile where you tell it the size of your RV. You can also tell it what type of roads to avoid. I set up my RV profile, told the app to avoid local roads if possible, and use freeways and divided highways as much as possible. Luckily we kind of knew the area, because the app tried to take us through the middle of Brooksville (a small town in FL)on 98 instead of the 98 truck route around Brooksville. Had we followed the app we would not have cleared a train overpass in the middle of town. I have also read the reviews for Co-Pilot RV and they have the same issues. Unfortunately I paid for the in app purchases before I knew how bad it was.

So the only hiccup I have had is while in Ireland, we exited a roundabout, instead of having ugh to the next roundabout too soon. and turn around, it sent us on a 10-20 minute detour and eventually telling me to turn around. Other than that one instance it has helped me travel all across the island without having to use data.

label_title: Great for up close, bad for planning routes on the fly
review: The great advantage to CoPilot is being able to download maps to your device so you don‚Äôt have to have cellular data as you wander. I like this feature. However, the program itself has issues, depending on how you use it. I chase storms and used it on my iPad this season in conjunction with a Bluetooth GPS device. I like to use the program in 2D map mode for situational awareness. I like that the map can be locked in the ‚Äúnorth up‚Äù position. But while it‚Äôs great for up-close views of the next farm road or the next few turns, when one zooms out even a little to plan a route, even major roads (U.S. routes and interstates) completely vanish, and others appear as segments if they appear at all. I understand secondary roads vanishing when zooming out, but major ones? The company says this is a ‚Äúfeature‚Äù that is not a priority at this time. I find it essential and am not sure the app was worth $14.99 for the limited functionality.

label_title: Great especially you lost cellular connection
review: When I was visiting Canada today, somehow my iPhone X lost the cellular signal. I heads back to us side and went to both Tmo and and Mac store in Bellingham, replaced a SIM card, diagnosed with Apple‚Äôs program, resets several time and finally get it work after done a factory reset with lengthy backup and restore. While driving to these two stores, both google map and apple map were not working and all my current searched destinations were stored there. Luckily I have purchase the satellite based GPS therefore find my way every where. Traveling to some mountain area and I‚Äôm sure the cellular signal for GPS could be very poor. Not giving 5 stars for sometimes the map was not so current. May need update more frequently.

This app is great, there are a few things that needs to be improved. 1 is it will have you making illegal turns on one way streets . 2 of there is construction going on the app doesn‚Äôt pick it up and reroute you, even if you ride pass it the assigned route it will keep trying to reroute you back to the original route that was closed.
The map needs update.

I have several nav/gps apps.  This one is well-designed to use/see while you're driving. It has viewing modes.  It's very unique in that while moving it will adjust the route automatically, lets you preview the route, route planning with easy to add waypoints, accepts place marks, and offers a parking mark when you arrive.  I bought the Lifetime Navigation. 

Preview/Plan Routes!!  You can preview the route in detail.  Plus planning with uniquely easy waypoints - adding stops along the way - and routing between stops.  Most nav apps don't permit a preview of a route in detail.   It's helpful to see or get familiar with the road names and route.  Other nav apps only show you entire routes in one distant view.  Only when you hit "Go" can you see the route detail.  Beyond annoying.

Auto Reroute!!  When I go off the route due to detour, missed turn, or whim, it changes the route based on where I am - not where I should be.  It does so quickly, ex. in a neighborhood, if you miss a turn/road it will adjust the route to the next turn/road.  Fantastic when there's a detour or traffic jam, you just go elsewhere and it will keep you going forward from there. It does NOT repeat "turn around" over and over and direct me to Uturn at each intersection I drive past.  Can't cancel/restart a route, it's difficult while driving and usually they go back to the same route you got off of.  So I have to turn other nav apps off. 

Wish:  need a Watch app.  One with next route step view and hepatic turn indication.
(Like the Apple Map.)   

Thanks for a great app!
I put in a city and street that was 10 min ride it could not find the street and said the city was over an hour away!! Sorry something is really wrong!

Please Update for iPhone X
And New Road
Thanks

label_title: Almost A Great GPS But Not Quite
review: I‚Äôve been testing different kinds of GPS apps available. But there‚Äôs one feature I‚Äôm looking for which is not available in the settings, the avoid toll feature. This is readily available in others so if you coud add this in the settings then it would be great. On the otherhand, the offline reliablity beats the top perforning app. So if you‚Äôre running out of data and in places where there‚Äôs barely a signal, this feature helps a lot. Moreover, the display is amazingly colorful which makes it not boring when compared to others. I‚Äôll continue to use it and let you know if there are other problems I can find.
There are still areas out west with no cell service. An app like this saves a lot of time with paper maps. I‚Äôve found the maps accurate and up to date.
A good app and can use offline. Very nice.

Don‚Äôt waste your money worst app ever does not work I paid for upgrades nothing works all they want is to sell you more stuff I am contacting Apple a tell them I want a refund this app is an absolute joke

label_title: Worked great overseas without cell coverage
review:
My wife & I traveled to Italy recently. Before we left the States I downloaded the map of Italy and identified our key destinations and the routes between them.

CoPilot worked perfectly our entire time in Italy. We did not need to use any cell phone coverage. CoPilot knew every little road we took & when we made a wrong turn it always led us back. 

The only time CoPilot got confused was when we were in a big city with tall buildings around & my phone lost the GPS signal. That could happen with any GPS device, however, so I don‚Äôt fault CoPilot. Once my phone caught the signal, CoPilot was right there. 

I particularly liked having the routes planned in advance. When we traveled off the beaten path, I could easily retrieve a saved destination and, bam, CoPilot would route us there. Easy-peasy. 

Since we do not speak Italian, CoPilot gave us, me in particular since I did all the driving, a lot of confidence on the road. No need to have a road map open. No stress over asking, ‚ÄúIs this our exit? On what street do I turn? How do you spell that? Ack!‚Äù CoPilot gave us plenty of advance notice & clear directions. Whew!

I recommend this app.

It seems with each update i find more bugs, wrong routing, roads and interchanges that are inaccurate and the occasional route in circles with no resolution.  I found the app to be nearly useless in South Miami, Phoenix, and New Orleans.

I downloaded this app trying to compare with WAZE, first thing I notice is that you have to pay for voice after the free trail. Ah... WAZE is freeeeee. Didn‚Äôt even try it, deleted the app right away.

The first trip using this app was 40 miles with the camper in tow. I had set up my profile for the RV. This app tried to turn me into a pasture, twice. I had just paid for the unlimited voice package. Can I get my money back?

label_title: Great app, but no iPhone X support
review: It would be five stars if there were iPhone X support. It‚Äôs been out for over four months and I‚Äôm still dealing with black bars at the top and bottom.

I am a trucker and I've been testing this GPS for about 3 months now. I know it's not designed for trucks but I use it along my truck GPS anyway. I recommend it for anyone that's always on the road across the country , specially in places where there will be no data connection. You can set up a profile for an RV which can help avoid restricted roads, I've only had a couple of instances where it took me to a restricted road , but ultimately you  should never rely 100 % on any GPS . I like very much the next-turn feature , it gives you enough time to be in the lane you're supposed to be in. i really love that since I'm driving a big rig, I've tested it in most cities and works fine. There's been rare cases where it has failed to warn me of lane changes. I like the map color themes and other info display features. One complaint that I have is the 3D mode is barely 3D, I wish it was tilted at a lower angle a little further to give a 3D feel, as if seeing further ahead. Overall this is a great app/gps for its full price, it works everywhere and it's very reliable. Thanks
After wasting long time to download it worked without guidance or turn to turn and asked me upgrade and this is only a trial version
The map does not show up
I'm on my second attempt to resolve an issue, but emails go unanswered. It's a good app, but expect support.
Can't say I care for this app. It's really hard to use. Not very intuitive
I have had problems with this app. I purchased the 3D map & it says it was never installed. I can‚Äôt contact the developer. Very unhappy & frustrated.
I love this app, wanted to purchase lifetime license. But when I tried the trial version exploring, found the speed limit is not getting displayed in the Map.

Sometimes this app cannot find very simple locations in S. California.  Maps need to be updated more often. 
Also would be nice to add the capability of record a routing so  we would be able to create a route that we like or use it when the route that the gps chooses is not a good one. 

Need improvement
It‚Äôs useful app
I hope for copilot team to reduce price of guidance and navigating

Good to use but be aware that you have to look at the route before 
‚ÄúFollowing blindly what a machine tells you to do‚Äù. Always look before you leap/drive. I usually set up ‚Äúway points‚Äù on the map. 

It of course is great to use in areas that are unfamiliar. Better than most but I usually cross check with google maps to make sure. 

Google maps use a data connection which copilot does not..saving data charges. Google maps will give you a satellite image/street view which copilot can‚Äôt. At least before you go you can check the easiest entry/exit points of your location with google. 

Information is knowledge. More is better on both accounts. For the price and convienace I can‚Äôt beat it.
Love the ‚Äúroute through here‚Äù option if you find a quicker way...the app and services get better with every update, keep it going guys!üëç
Excellent and useful app ever. Like a year, I‚Äôm using to CoPilot never get interrupted any tech problem. Thanks and make more easy use for users.

The app is good as all others are. Asia maps are incomplete and not worth the money. Other apps are far less expensive with China, Hong Kong included.

Wasted my money.

Inexpensive gps app that‚Äôs nice to have. I‚Äôve encounter situation where cellular reception  didn‚Äôt work and had to rely on copilot to find where I‚Äôm going. Or when you don‚Äôt have unlimited cellular data and had to do long distance driving, so it‚Äôs nice to have an app with the maps downloaded locally.
Best navigation app , I'm very happy with it ...
Best Gps I have so far.

Most excellent!  For several years now, I have travelled along the U.S. East coast and Northward into Canada with no problems.  Since Copilot is a dedicated GPS app, independence from a live internet connection is most helpful when my cellphone had no cellular internet service domestically due to cellular reception conditions and when traveling abroad.  Highly recommend.

Update:  I like and regularly use the Copilot setting whick keeps the the top edge of the map oriented to the North, so that I can visually dtermine my actual compass heading.  In a recent update, Copilot moved the icon depicting my vehicle location to the edge of the map/screen opposite the direction of my direction of travel affording me a full-screen view of the rest of my device's screen indicating the route, directions, traffic & points of interest ahead. Tr√©s bien / very well done Copilot!

Wish it was easier to plan a 4+ day trip with ease.

Deleting the app.

I love this app.  It‚Äôs details are superior to others.  It‚Äôs ability to multi route additional stops and way points is great.  The colors on screen an custom ones are just great.  When you need precision and accuracy this is the app to get hands down!

label_title: Sorry I Upgraded. So very, very sorry. Yikes...really bad update
review:
I have finally switched to a Garmin GPS in desperation, but I miss my iPad and it's CoPilot (old version). I hope that the app designers will bring back the old version. You were the premier GPS navigation tool for me.  1/22/2017

Still, if I really need to get somewhere, I use my Garmin. And where are the polar coordinates in decimal output I expected.  Easy on my Garmin.

For on road navigation, this app gets you there.  With onboard maps, Worth the $10 for voice navigation.  Functions fine in Cellular dead zones, as long as your GPS is up and running.

Off road navigation, forget about it, the app even has problems with parking lots.

iOS users with voice navigation:  You can stop Copilot from screaming at you through SETTINGS / MUSIC / EQ select: Late Night.
Worked great going to Alaska until last update now not at all worked great in march and may can I get old one back

label_title: This gps might get you lost...
review:
The maps and directions are terrible compared to purpose built gps.  I so badly wanted this to work so I could use my iPad as a gps, but in direct comparison to a Garmin it really showed it's shortcomings. 
It baffles me when I read reviews saying this app is the greatest... but when I buy the app, it's terrible.  Why would you folks give this a positive review?  Are the reviews verified?  If you can't trust the gps then why use it?  Hope I can get a refund...

Update - I received an email with some links on how to use the app and asking if I can help them to identify the bugs... This isn't a card game or face swap, this is an app that can cost you an untold amount of money in lost time and gas.  Please issue a refund.

label_title: Choose your own route AND follow it!
review: I've used this app to travel from NY to Florida. Before leaving my house I was able to choose MY route AND follow it. So many other apps only give you three choices or you can pick a route you want only to find the app reverts to Apple or Google maps. Not this one! I chose each leg of my route before leaving and saved them separately. Each morning I opened the route of the day. U did find a couple map mistakes, but I submitted them within it a problem. I did find that when attempting to plan my route with my iPad, the times were off, but it may be that due to the fact that there are so many settings. And I am still learning, that the problem was me! On my phone (with LTE) the time is accurate. So happy to have found this app!
Been using Co-Pilot along time.  Still the best navigation program I have ever used.
Really needs and option for HUD

So now not only did they screw up the app, that all of us have in one way or other INVESTED money, but judging from the email I just hot we are left holding zilch!! As most of YOUR customers have stated on reviews, take this app back 1 year, because as of now, I'm gonna start looking into alternatives because not only is this app user unfriendly, it's bland, (this the reason I purchased themes).

label_title: Better than google and Apple maps
review: Kk

We have been looking for something to replace our Garmin GPS DEZL (trucking GPS).  We were deeply disappointed when our Garmin stopped giving us good directions (I think Garmin stopped supporting it) and we started looking for something that could replace it. We looked at Rand McNally tablets but couldn't get past some of the bad reviews. So I tried this. We have used this through two states (on our iPad) and are very pleased so far. I like the fact that they have an RV and a Trucker version where we can set weight, length, width, and height restrictions in it. We are planning on upgrading soon to accommodate our trailer restrictions. My only complaint is that the speed limit indicator didn't work in one of the states (Indiana). This is slightly picky but I expect all aspects of the app to work when it says they will. That being said, I am very pleased with this app and would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a versatile and programmable app for navigation, especially those who are towing anything.

label_title: Overall great! Map updates a chore
review:
I use CoPilot in North America and in Europe on an iPad and an iPhone: this alone places it ahead of most other navigation systems. A wonderful fix over Garmin, Magellan, and their ilk. I love knowing that copilot on pads is frequently used by professional aircraft pilots in the cockpit!
Updating maps on other devices was either a ridiculously expensive process or a near impossible, slow, often-failing download then upload process. This is greatly simplified and affordable (so far free!) with CoPilot. However, on my iPhone and iPad, getting map updates takes several restarts as the device goes to sleep. I would like to see CoPilot improve this process, making a very good navigation system excellent!

Terrible support. Bait and switch. 

They removed Google POI search. 

Their support claims it's to improve app performance. I don't see how? Is Google slowing you down? Sure.
I love the recording feature!
Copilot Help screens require Online connection - which is useless when traveling using its Offline maps.
Save your money , this app is going backwards,getting less usable not better. Apple maps gives almost same functionality and it's free !
Has not let me down so far so many other ones did

Have used this with great experience on Android tablet for several years. Just installed iPad version, but have had no acceptable results. It shows me where I am, at home and at stops along the way, but it does not advance as I drive. It is a map but not a navigator. ???

I bought this then paid for in app purchases.  Then I loaded the tour bus dimensions and road preferences.  The routes I received avoided low over passes (what I wanted) but also took me down residential roads and tight turns I was unable to navigate that had signs for no trucks.

Support is basically non existent -  I've given up and won't give more money for other apps they provide until I know I can transfer all my existing purchases for traffic etc to new App along with a way to get refund if it doesn't work as expected.
Did you guys forget to put Minnesota on your Maps? Every time I put a Minnesota address and nothing shows up thank you.

label_title: Love the app, but crashes all the time now
review: Really love the app, but something happened in last update and it crashes immediately after opening.

label_title: If you drive, you need this app!
review:
Once you learn how to save your favorites, you will be able to build a route and optimize it for zero driving in circles. My productivity has doubled since buying this app. 

There are some drawbacks.

Some of the search functions seem over complicated, unless you're looking for a bar or restaurant.

You can't simply type a full address into the search bar, you have to do city or zip, then street, then number. Not a huge issue, but could be easier.

Over time the favorites seem to duplicate themselves. Again, this is no big deal, and probably something I'm doing wrong.

Lastly, gps is not a substitute for common sense. No gps is as accurately as you think it should be. This flaw lies at the heart of the  gps satellites and address registries, and not with any specific program.

Stay alert, watch for clearance obstructions, and maintain a safe following distance.

Drivers are found dead with their phones in their hands, with a gps program still running. Don't be a statistic.
Been using this app for years and it worked great, TILL NOW! Latest update is a bust. Where are my favorites, why no voice at times and why so difficult to change screen size on the fly?

This product no longer tracks on my IPhone 6s with IOS 10.2.1.  It will show my correct position on start up, but does not update the map as I am driving.  Other navigation apps such as Waze and Google Maps work just fine.  I have deleted and reinstalled the app to no avail.

I have used Copilot in North America and Europe for years. It was easy to use both to plan and execute a given trip.

The latest update is horrible. Nothing is remotely the same. Nothing is intuitive. It is clunky and slow.

I guess I got my money's worth but I don't want to use it until they fix it

This latest CoPilot is a big step up and works very well. A brilliant app which I recommend to friends all time. If you live in an area with patchy cell service this app will revolutionize your driving because it doesn't need a connection to work. This means that it also works well when you are want to not use roaming data, like when you are overseas. It downloads the maps in advance and only uses the gps. This is awesome.
Major design flaw of only searching current location or specific city.   Will not search map being viewed. Excellent except for this flaw (do the designers use the product?)

I've tried other offline maps and none of them seem to work very well. None of them allow me to customize my own routes. Instead the app picks it's own route which is usually way out of the way and then the alternate routes are even worse. I can set waypoints with this app unlike others I've tried. My only gripe is the ETA is off. It calculates my trip that is supposed to be 10 hours as a few hours later.
Thank You IT Guys great app for highway use
Thanks for giving the drivers an app this valuable

label_title: I like the app and paid for the voice but sometimes it will not talk to me
review: Could be better voice for the price, mine works sometimes and sometimes not.

As a professional driver for a dealership I need a reliable and accurate GPS app.  In the two years of usage this app has been outstanding.  It is accurate 99% of the time.  I have tried other apps but always revert back to Copilot GPS.
Have had this app for years and it manages to have great updates while maintaining its efficient navigation with excellent expected arrival time estimates.
I've been using copilot for about 3 years and have never had any problems. It always gets me where I need to go

Offline maps never let you down?  How about never works.  On offline it thinks your 10-20 miles behind where your really at, think your on the next road off when your not. It's garbage get google maps and save the headache

label_title: Latest version is a huge step forward
review: I have always required an app with offline maps since cell coverage is so spotty in the Appalachians. The previous version was laborious to perform route planning but the recents upgrades make impromptu routing a snap. Think everyone will Love it.

The ONLY redeeming quality to this app is that its maps are already on my phone.

Over the years of having this app, it's been waaay more frustrating that using google maps and losing the data signal -rendering it useless.

Entering an address can be a serious challenge. If copilot doesn't like your entry, it simply disregards it and offers a few that might be kinda sorta close-ish to what you're looking  for. One of the options offered is to use a contact, which is great... if copilot likes it.

I drive a big-truck and I have contacts, with addresses, for businesses all over the USA. The addresses I have are provided by the companies themselves, and I'm pretty sure that they know their own addresses. And, both google maps and apple maps can find these addresses, and get me there every time. I know what you're thinking, then just use those. I do. But, it's always nice to have a map already on my phone, because sometimes I need to be on a phone call and with Sprint/Verizon it can be a matter of one or the other, but frequently not both. Also, I like some of the options that copilot offers.

The speed limit option only seems to work in a few states, and quite often they're wrong because the state had increased its limits. I'm thinking that months is more than enough time to have corrected the changes. Yea, I know, copilot relies on its users for help in updating and correcting its maps -which as far as I'm concerned is bunk.

If I could have gotten my money back all those many moons ago, I would have.

Perhaps it works well for those who stay within the limits of their city, but the whole idea behind using a map is to get you from where you are, to wherever it is that you wish to go, and with copilot it's a hit and miss kinda deal. Not good enough. Frankly, my wife uses waze and seems to be quite satisfied. Sure wish it worked for trucks.

label_title: Works flawlessly in USA and Mexico without cell service
review: I have relied on copilot for several years while living in Texas. Several months ago I retired to Mexico. Although Copilot's Anglicized pronunciation of Spanish street names is a little jarring, the directions are spot on. Another feature I really like is that the map database (or selected portions if you are tight for storage) can be downloaded and stored on your device. This allows me to navigate accurately in US national parks, foreign countries, and other areas lacking both wifi and cell service. I did have one problem with the app that required contacting tech support about a year ago. The problem was completely resolved by removing and reinstalling the app. No problems after that.

label_title: This is fraud, apple should be ashamed
review: I and my wife paid for this app. The audio does not function. Absolutely no sound. Audio just worked once. This app is a total fraud and a waste. Apple should be ashamed of them selves for allowing this consumer fraud.

label_title: Great App but Needs to be More User Friendly
review: I don't use the app that often but when I do I really need it to work. Thus far I have been impressed with the navigation. I used it in October for a long road trip to backwater USA and it worked like a dream! However, I do wish it was more user friendly. The app itself is extremely difficult to navigate and not at all intuitive. For someone who doesn't use it all the time it is very frustrating to try to figure out everthing all over again when you need to use it. Please, PLEASE, make this great app even better by making the menus more intuitive and user friendly.

label_title: Screwing up a good app -- misunderstanding the customers
review:
I switched to Copilot a few years ago after Telenav totally screwed up Telenav GPS and Scout by messing with the interface and removing features important to business users.

Now the developers of Copilot have made the same DUMB mistakes, so I'm deleting Copilot and moving on.

I could get used to the UI changes, but switching the online seach function from Google to . . . What? Yelp? . . . is bafflingly stupid.  And not giving users a choice of which search engine they want to use?  Really?

(HINT:  not everyone uses GPS to find restaurants and clubs to connect with friends after work.)

The beauty of Copilot used to be this: when you couldn't find a destination in Copilot's built-in database,  you could type (or better: dictate) the name of the business (e.g., a lawyers office, or plumbing supply store) into the Google search box, click on the Google result, and Copilot would automatically capture the business' address, plug it in and start plotting the route.  No more, because (1) and somehow this may come as a surprise to the developers:  Yelp is NOT AS POWERFUL as Google, and (2) to be honest, Yelp doesn't really care all that much about businesses that aren't dining or entertainment venues (so good luck with that plumbing supply store).

The two litmus tests I now use for GPS apps: (1) do the developers insist that you authorize them to track your whereabouts, by turning on location services, EVEN WHEN YOU'RE NOT USING THEIR APP?  If so, I click on the little "x" and delete the app.   Three words: NOT DOING THAT.  (I'm looking at you Waze, and others) 

Litmus test #2?   I type the name of locally well-known business I visit regularly into the search box.  Does the GPS accept business names or just addresses?  (If it can't deal with business names, app gets deleted.)  Then, does the app accurately find/identify the business?  (If it offers only one suggestion 900 miles away . . .  Yup, you guessed it: app gets deleted.  And finally, can the app automatically capture the business' address to plot the route?  (If it makes me type in the address, app gets deleted.)

We are way, way, way past the days when users were forced search for a destination in the Google app, remember the address, then switch to the GPS app and type, or cut & paste, the address into the GPS destination box. These apps are supposed to work for us, not the other way around.

So, goodbye Copilot, hello Google's own GPS/mapping app.  It passes all the litmus tests, and IT JUST WORKS.

The new interface is a good improvement,  I use CoPilot to plan trips and its save and load feature and international map options wins over its competition. 

One aspect of the load trip operation it that it adds 'current location' as item one no matter what was the saved starting point. I consider this a minor inconvenience because deleting that item is very easy. 

Another issue I have had is that it seems very easy to lose a trip plan, so I use the 'Save' often when trip planning. 

The various Search features seem more capable than the previous version's searches.

The map's point-to and route-through-here is a superb improvement over the drag route operation, it does a good job of inserting it into the trip, and when it misses reordering the stops and way-points is very easy.

I would like the capability to see the distance and time betwen trip stops. If it can now I have not found it yet.
Not bad but can use some improvement in making it more easy to use like a listing of previous addresses used and better interface, look to motion X drive for examples

This app is not written for iOS, it is something ported over. It lacks every address I entered. For some strange reason it wants me to leave my house and travel down a tiny alley instead of the street in front of my house when I try to plot a trip. It makes me wonder where else it is going to route me on a real trip. I can't find a way to plan a trip so that I travel on the roads I wish to travel on - the waypoints seem to have to be an address so it wants you to get off the highway. It is the most awkward interface I have ever seen on an iOS app. I have many more issues with this app after trying to plan a simple route, but in short, I just gave up and deleted it. A paper map would be easier.
This app is better than the map apps included in my iPhone. The graphics are much better. I used to use Maps and Google Maps to navigate but now I'm using CoPilot GPS. Best decision ever.

I bought the free version of CoPilot some years ago but never used it. Then on a trip to Connecticut, a Garmin failed, and while my wife drove, I navigated with CoPilot, which took us to within one house of our destination.  I bought the unlimited voice-navigation feature the next day.  .   Just recently, I lost the Voice Navigation, then couldn't log in (a complaint of someone els below).  I contacted support and found them very helpful.  It turned out that my account had been corrupted; the simplest solution was to choose a new email login and
 when I did that support (Ashley) restored the lost Voice Navigation.   

I still use iOS 6 6.1.6 on an  IPhone 3GS. CoPilot deserves a larger screen. for optimal use.  Still even with my thick fingers,  dragging to change routes  works well  and  the GPS navigates successfully even in areas without WIFI and  cell reception.  One thing I've noticed is that CoPilot acquires Satellites much faster than the Garmin in my wife's car, which can delay for minutes, a real problem if I don't really know how to start a trip.

label_title: The app doesn't deliver what it says it does
review: After months of use, it is my opinion that the app doesn't deliver the features it proclaims.  The source data lacks current drive speeds and routes me on dirt roads which is not always navigable by a motorbike or small RV.  Other apps have as much or more features without the purchased add-ons.  This does not meet my criteria for a serious navagational app.   So rethink your requirements before purchasing this app.

label_title: Off line maps=great, features not so good
review:
Remote travel requires offline maps which this app does great. But, navigation is sometimes misleading by missing freeway exits of roads. Also, multiple features are only half implemented, eg vehicle preferred speed doesn't change travel time.???
Daft marketing to sell a specialized RV version with only two additional features and demand full payment from existing non RV version users. Annoying. 
Bottom line, expensive, works kinda, best option if offline maps are a necessity.
Best one I've ever seen!
Have had a chance to use it yet, but looking it over and studying it, feel it will definitely fill the bill.

label_title: Useless now that they haven't updated the app to allow for importing routes via iTunes File Sharing
review: I would give this app at least 4 stars based on previous experiences with it, especially the ability to import and load routes I've planned ahead of time on the computer. But they haven't updated it to allow for Apple's new requirement for file-sharing through iTunes. They've had over a year to add this into an update, but they haven't, so they get one star. Now there's no advantage to this map relative to any other free app other than having offline maps. But there are free apps that allow for this, so there's no point in buying CoPilot anymore. Get your act together guys. Seriously.

I have used Copilot IOS app for about two years, and I am now giving up on it. Used it for cross country motorcycle, RV and car travel. Recently the app took me for a 10 minute detour to a highway that was lass then a mile away. This has happened multiple times in the past, out of the way routings for no reason.  Recently the app incorrectly named multiple state highways and had me turning onto other roads (twice yesterday) because it thought the highway I was on ended then started back up in a short distance, which I could see they did not break. Loading maps to local device is nice, but the network routing needs help. Also, I like to plan my own route and preciously the software pointed me in circles because it thought the waypoint was off road. Creating your own route takes wY too long and has to be done on the device. Very frustrating!!
Great app. I downloaded North America map and used it between NYC and Montreal. Worked great!

Some time back, I had to delete and reinstall the app on my iPhone. Since then I haven't been able to log in and get at all those perfectly swell features inside. No matter what I do, I. can't  reset my password--nor can I get past the dialogue boxes. I'm in an endless loop and ready to frag something. PLEASE PROVIDE DIRECT EMAIL ACCESS TO SOMEONE WITH A PULSE. Canned FAQs are never enough by themselves.

Not to mention that you have to buy the full application. All in all it cost around 45 USD just to be able to navigate in one country.

label_title: Missing a lot of major POIs
review:
I reviewed this app as a potential GPS for our motorhome, and found that it is missing almost all of the Walmart stores where we live. And we live where the oldest stores exist, near the Walmart headquarters. It's sad when retail is a category and the worlds largest retailer does not even show up in most cases.

I was considering buying the RV edition for $49, but if the normal edition doesn't even show Walmart stores then I can only imagine how many RV-related locations are probably missing.

label_title: Great for using without wifi or internet access
review: I often drive in areas without any type of online access. This is great for that. The main flaw is that it will not accept every street address that want to drive to. It will give you "nearby" suggestions, but the last one I tried "nearby" was two miles away from my destination.
Just a few streets in my area need updating. The app itself is great! Thanks for the hard work.

I've been using it for a while now since my Magellan died. 

I love the multiple stops since having a large route with multiple stops and being able to optimize them is essential for me. It's not always accurate on where those stops are exactly like other GPS's, so I tend to drive past my stop which is an issue in cities. 

It fails to know one way streets, dead ends and no left turns.  Annoying but the quick re-routing makes it only a little annoying. 

Adding the stops is quick and easy. Saving multiple favorites is also an option. 

Well worth the $10.
very good app
The free version works well...just would be nice if the voice commands would not be for only a "7 day trial"
9 out of 10 times this gps app has failed with wrong directions. I.e. North highway v south, left v right.  It's a good thing I can find my way out of my own neighborhood!  I give up!!

In writing this review I tried different nicknames to post with.  "Lost in space,
Where am I", just to give an idea of the problems with the app.  Both already taken, so the consensus  is not good.  Tried many different times to use app. When the stars aligned and it could find a satellite, it would not track movement and kept starting directions from beginning.  Borrowed a GPS unit and it showed 10 satellites, and CoPilot couldn't link with one out in the open, no trees, buildings, mountains around. Needs much improvement in the app.

First trip went well.  Second trip, voice stopped even tho I have unlimited voice guide and the GPS did not work correctly.  We were going to same place as first trip.  I ended up using different GPS.
Best Gps App Hands Down When Your Phone Service Isn't Even Working
