If you RV, you need this App! This makes looking for an RV Park easy, no matter where you travel. Get it, use it.

label_title: Best reference app for any RV'r or Camping traveler
review: This app should be a major presentation at RV shows. It shows pics, road and parking conditions, user reviews, everything needed to plan trips. There is nothing more comprehensive out there for RV'rs who travel across our nation or who like to boondock at Walmarts!  Also, you users keep posting reviews. It's your reviews that keep the rv parks friendly and neat! ...Jest sayin!

Found this app to be very useful and easy to use. Filters are available, and so far works well for me.
We used this app on our travels to Las Vegas and Palm Springs, excellent!
Couldn't imagine traveling without it
Very good. Saved our butt looking for a place to sleep
So far we are very happy with this app, although we could use more reviews on parks.
Great app as you scroll through map the CG's show up. All don't show up, usually dry camping areas, primitive areas. Wish more reviews were available. Much better than Woodall's or Good Sam.
Nice to have a single app to search out camp grounds as we travel the USA!
I love this App!  It is so helpful when traveling!
I love this site!  We are full timers, and this site will let me find a park just down the road with the rolling maps!  It's awesome!
My husband and I like this app very much. It's going to be helpful during our travels.
Great app for finding various types of campgrounds.
For planning and even in route this app is a great help for motor home needs
Great app for camping.  Works great

label_title: This is THE RV travel app to have
review: I used to juggle through tons of different applications looking for information of quick overnights, long and short term campgrounds, and just places to stay in general.  But with RV Parky, I‚Äôve reached the point that it‚Äôs the only app I ever use!  It‚Äôs great at providing links to locations themselves, as well as internal and external reviews of locations ‚Äî what more can you ask for?

label_title: Does what it is supposed to...
review: We have used this app a lot in the past 3 1/2 months and over 9000 miles.
Great App have been using on trip from California to Boston find it very useful
No problems from this app. Works very well on the fly.

Just found this app and it has been very helpful so far. Needs more users willing to give reviews as I find those most helpful.  Also many times when searching for a park in a US city I'm first directed to locations in Mexico or South America.   Second search comes back with the correct area.
Very good maps! Appreciate this app.
Good and accurate!!! AAA+++

This app is a lifesaver!

tim

label_title: Makes my life a LOT easier!
review: I drive tour buses for music groups - and do a lot of deadhead running to or from a tour.  Even as I write this, this app is proving its worth.  Local truck stops are totally full, but this app led me directly to the local Walmart, where several RVs and semis had already parked up.  Not the first time it's come to the rescue.  Highly recommended!!!
Simple and Easy. Best App for finding Campgrounds and also has great Boondocking choices included in each Search! It's a must have Folks!üëç
Really helps find rv parks. I like that reviews are current. Would help if we could search by map of California.

Works just as nice as other apps but as it is new it needs more users. In time when word gets out, this could be the one to have. The filter works great and the interface is very easy to understand. I like it. No reason why it's not five stars. Good job.
I have used this several times now and find that it provides all the information you need to select the best RV park that will fit your needs.  Very user friendly.

I've looking for an alternative to AllStays Camp & RV because frankly it's too expensive to keep on our multiple devices.  I like to do my trip plans using my iPad but on the road I prefer to use my phone.  With AllStays I had to buy 2 copies at $9.99 each.  Ouch!

I've been comparing this app side by side with AllStays while planning our next trip.  RVParky can find more of the small towns I've been researching than the AllStays app and the ability to set favorites is a big plus.  The real proof will be when we take it on the road next month.  I'm concerned what will happen when we're out of cellular range.
This app was a great help finding convenient and clean RV parks on our trip through Oregon.   Found some nice spots we may have otherwise missed.

label_title: Price was nearly doubled at park
review: I relied on this site once now I will delete ap.  Got to Alliance NE Sunset RV and motel.  Instead of costing 19.00 it was 30.00.
Awesome
Excellent app. Very useful
After using all the RV apps to locate campsites and other overnight parking, this app is the WINNER, hands down !

I found this app to be quite comprehensive. It provides timely information and accurate detail. The author of the app is quick to respond when suggestions are made. The app is accurate enough so that you don't have to see venues that you are not interested in. I like it very much.
I found this app helpful
Not only does this app help find good places to camp, it shows RV friendly stores and restaurants. But best of all, it easily shows rest stops which is great with the traveling I do.

Finally!!! Simple search by city and state, or search nearby. All locations are shown on a map. If nearby shows your location. Good icon info on each Park page. Simple to read reviews however the app is new and many parks don't show any reviews. Developer included a button which takes you to a Safari window for an automatic Internet search. Highly recommended!!!

After reading all the awesome reviews in trade mags and listening to word of mouth I was looking for this app. I thought it was called RVParky; it took me a few mins but finally found it. Worth every penny. This software is simple and to the point - Useful. When I buy a hybrid vehicle, I will use this app to find a charging station.

Awkward user interface. Can‚Äôt find where to change search distance or even see what it is. Does seem to cover campsites the other apps overlook. Not many campsite ratings yet. A work in progress but promising.

I‚Äôve been using this app for over a year now and it has brought me to some of the most beautiful campgrounds. I‚Äôm a big penny pincher so the fact that you can search for free or cheap sites is my favorite part. You‚Äôre able to read others reviews and browse pictures before heading to the site. It even links your map apps to the gps coordinates ensuring you can get there stress (and paper map) free. I‚Äôve recommended this app to all my fellow traveling friends. Thanks Campendium for helping me find some hidden treasures!
I use this blinking app all the f-ing time when I‚Äôm movin‚Äô me ‚Äòouse on wheels to a new front garden.

Lucked out on our way to Breitenbush and scored a cancellation on the river loop!  Reed and Linda do a fabulous job keeping everyone happy and the loop is perfectly manicured!  Sites are huge and ours was neatly raked. Lovely hiking trails along the river. We will definitely return!!
If you are looking for big open space,spacious sites, great views and a truly great experience. Watching hot air balloons lifting off across the reservoir was a real treat.

Beautiful beach just below this campground. Flush toilets, pay showers, some full hook ups. Group camp sites available at some of the best spots in the park. Nice little museum/Park store, Jr. Rangers in the summer.
Can‚Äôt travel without it
We have used this for so long that I don‚Äôt believe the other maps can keep up!
Wonderful area to camp at. Clean bathrooms. Nice fish cleaning station.
We pulled in for an overnight stay on our way to glacier national park. Love the trees and the staff was very friendly. I would stay here again.

We have a beautiful camp site next to a small waterfall. I was able to park my large fifth wheel camper with no problems. Surrounded by mountains. The train does come by often and must blow its horn due to the road crossing so bring ear plugs if your a light sleeper.
Great UI, lots of information including cell signal in a lot of sites
Beautiful clean campsites

If you like camping, or road trips, or even know what BLM land is, you need to have this. It‚Äôs that simple! Kind of want to camp out at what looks like a good enough spot to stop the RV on google earth? There‚Äôs probably pictures of it already on Campendium, along with whether it has cell coverage or not, and from which providers. And someone will likely have left a review saying which sizes of RVs could safely turn around down that other road you were looking at. Then take that location, open it in Apple or Google Maps or copy the GPS coordinates for further planning. 

My favorite anecdotes from the last year of using it all boil down to ‚Äúa few reviews warned how bad this six miles of washboard road are, which would have deterred us otherwise, but they said it was worth it so we kept going and it WAS; or not knowing where to stay in an area and finding some unmarked hollow on the side of a mountain, unbelievably scenic but shockingly close to town. There‚Äôs so much out there other adventurous folks like you will help you find!

Get Campendium, go outside, and stay there.
Dos
Nice and clean, friendly, great dog runs and best of all Women Only private showers! üòç
Nice app , love it

label_title: Final stop on a 3k mile road trip
review: We had been on the road for 18 days and have traveled through 8 states and were looking for a great place to cap off our amazing trip before we headed for home in the Bay Area. The drive was from Portland to crescent city. We booked the day of after we had already arrived in town around 4pm and grabbed some dinner. We had kinda lucked out as there was only 1 spot left for full hookups. The lady answering the phone was super nice and said they only had a 50 amp spot left and I‚Äôd need to get An adapter for my 30 amp cord. I picked one up for $20 and headed to the RV Park. This place is beautiful. It‚Äôs planted in a heavily wooded redwood tree grove and most spots are separated pretty decently so it‚Äôs almost like you have your own little forest. My spot #80 was a little tricky to back into with my 16 foot travel trailer because it sat at an angle but was able to get it into place with out too much maneuvering. Went to hook up and the site had a 50 amp and a standard 110 GFCI outlet ( Which I already had an adapter for) so I didn‚Äôt need to pick up a 50-30 adapter but not a problem cus it‚Äôs good to have anyhow. Anyhow the check in was nice each campsite has its own fire ring. The main reason we came here was because it seemed kid friendly and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. There were. Bunch of kids and lots of activities near the office including a nice playground. My daughter had a great time with the other kids. The only downside was I wasn‚Äôt able to use the WiFi in my trailer which isn‚Äôt the worst thing but would have been nice to relax after such a long trip and watch a movie or something. Anyhow we paid 62 dollars for the night with full hookups, with cable, a bit steep but worth it if you get a good site. Ours was super quiet despite being close to the 101 freeway. There is a cool walking trail as well onsite so be sure to check that out on the west end of the park. The office person did warn me of potential break ins and theft around crescent city so be sure tuck belonging away just to be safe but we had no issue. They sell firewood and if I heard correctly it was 16 dollars for a bundle so bring your own if that‚Äôs the case haha. All and all I would stay here again if I came through the area and would recommend it if you don‚Äôt mind paying a little extra for a beautiful campground, as some of the others in the area were not remotely as nice as this one.
What an incredible view 360 üèî with a beautiful rainbow üåà and hummingbirds galore
The woman who checked us in was very helpful and just plain nice. So appreciated. The campground had everything we needed. Would be happy to stay here again.

Just downloaded the app and immediately can tell this is a keeper. Easy and intuitive, actual user reviews, photos, etc. One nifty feature i noticed is the option to ‚Äúshow in maps‚Äù, which then gave me the option to use google maps (or other map apps if you prefer them). Sweet. No flipping back and forth trying to view the campground in satellite or street view, or messing with a map app you‚Äôre not familiar with. Very handy! 5 stars just for that haha. Seems to be an app made by campers for campers.

Great app with a great filter system, and good feedback from other campers complete with dates, site numbers, and cell reception. Used mostly this for a cross country motorcycle camping trip.

That said it is missing some state parks and other camping areas occasionally, so I use another camping locator map to supplement the missing info.
We camped near the water... would come back for sure.

label_title: Have to create an account to use
review: It is stupid to require creating an account to use the app.
Nicely spaced with lots of room campsites. All with concrete pads. Picnic tables. Right on LAke Michigan. Full hook ups with cable tv included. Very nice showers and laundry.
Had difficulty signing up, but got it. Hint: Can‚Äôt have a dot in your email address.

Campendium is an exceptional resource for campers!  It is the single best source of user reviews of public and private campgrounds and their associated amenities.

The mobile app is clean and and intuitive making it easy to both write your own reviews of campsites and read reviews written by others.  The interface makes it simple to upload photos of your campsite directly from your mobile device.

I personally use this app in conjunction with the new recreation.gov app to plan all my camping trips and make reservations for those high-demand campsites on federal lands.

KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK CAMPENDIUM.COM!!

label_title: Great place and very friendly staff
review: The family and I pulled in late night and just chose a spot to rest for the night. The staff was very welcoming the next morning. I ended up booking for one more night just because of the staff and the beautiful seclusion of the park.  We stayed in spot 14 which is set back in the park and right next to the creek which kept the kiddos busy for hours.  This place is about 8 miles down a graveled and dirt road, but definitely worth the 20 minute drive. We would definitely stay if we ever visit again.
New; works great, shows everything around and can go to maps and use 3D. it‚Äôs all i was looking for ;) soon going Campaign.

Every time I use this app, I find amazing camping spots! Easy to use. Great information. Great access to boondocking sites that aren‚Äôt easy to find anywhere else.  I can‚Äôt think of anything better to say.
The owner is amazing. Clean and friendly. Definitely would stay again. Price is absolutely affordable.

Beautifully designed app that works without a hitch. The interactive map is just excellent. It‚Äôs a similar to Google maps searching, but the Campendium map works more smoothly and is prettier and easier to read. 

I used Campendium a lot on my laptop until this mobile app came out, and this app is just as rich and functional as the desktop version. It‚Äôs the first place I look when I‚Äôm searching for campgrounds and reviews.

We had the most welcoming staff greet us and drive us to our site.  The sites are excellent and pretty level, heated pool, large area for dogs, a good size pond, and a hiking trail!  Thanks for the great experience
a lot of rv reviewers but i use it for overlanding in a 4runner. fine the remote sweet spot to camp!
I love the new updates! Using app is much easier and more enjoyable. 5 stars.
This beautiful app has truly changed the landscape of how we camp. The days of searching for hidden gems are over. Do yourself a favor and download this fantastic app.
Lots of camping here on top of the Mesa. Wasn‚Äôt crowded on a Thursday night. Got up early and was in the park for dawn

We spent a long weekend with our granddaughter and doggies.  The park had everything to include a little fishing pond‚Äîgranddaughter caught 3 fish.   Hookups for trailer (30 amp) we‚Äôre old, but reliable.  Facilities were clean and the grounds well maintained.   They need to replenish the benches and fire pits‚Äîbit old. Close to the American River.  Great value.
I use it regularly. I appreciate all the ways you can filter a search. Makes it easier to locate the type of options we want.
It‚Äôs my go to app for finding amazing camp spots

We are a RV rental company and we highly recommend this app to every one of our customers. Will use it ourselves and have found that we no longer even worry about making reservations at RV parks. We prefer to find a secluded area, this app allows that! Highly recommend it easy to use and so accurate. The more people have it and the more people put comments- locations the better this is going to get.

Zion park was a zoo on March 30th 2019 and all parks were full due to spring break. We hadn‚Äôt really figured we‚Äôd stay and are always giving our free spots first option and boy I‚Äôm glad we did. This Butte was like your own Zion experience with zero people at the very top and along a side road which boarders a canyon and breath taking views. We were in our 4x4 sprinter revel and needed every bit of it to master the tight corners, rocks and dips it needed to navigate. Definitely no big rigs past the first set of turnouts. Shared the top with a few mountain bikers but never saw them much. Could have stayed forever!!

label_title: Can‚Äôt add places in APP. Also can not update places in app
review: Great idea but would be better if the app was more user friendly. Everything must be done on website. App needs more capabilities!

The owners were super nice, found a spot for us, there a some residents here but they all seemed quite and kept to themselves, they offered a fire pit, little pricey at $30 for the night but was all around good

label_title: Best kept secret of the southern tip of the Sierras
review: This is our 2d trip to Red Rock, having stumbled onto this little gem a few years ago on our way to Death Valley. Last time the place was empty on arrival. This time, we arrived at 6p and freaked because the campground was nearly full. We had broken our ‚Äúget to campground by 1‚Äù rule, so I gave hubby the stink eye and tried to blame him. Then, magic. Our favorite spot - #50 - was still vacant! Waiting for us. Ok, it was one of the most unlevel spots in the campground, but who cares? That‚Äôs what levelers are for, right? Gorgeous sunset, and now spectacular pink sunrise. Warm during the day, freakin cold at night. They now have free WIFI! So hubby was pretty happy that he could still work (and watch Netflix). The trail right near #50 did not have a ‚Äúno dogs‚Äù sign, so as soon as I finish writing this I‚Äôm outta here with Sofie & Tyler!

I love this app- I‚Äôve used it almost exclusively to find places to camp while on a year-long camping trip. The only thing I wish they would fix is the $ symbols used to reflect how expensive sites are. You will see a campsite for $20 rated as $$$, then an RV park in a nearby area for $41 rated as $$. Fixing this confusing system would make it a legit 5 star!

We were here in March 2019. On our way yo New England. Large parking lot plenty of space. Open24 hrs and fairly quiet. Went in for food and drink and to play. Horse racing happens Wednesday thru Saturday so we missed it. Nice facility.
This is the best camping spot finder I have found. Even better than All Stays. I use both, but prefer and enjoy Campendium. Very helpful, informative, and really user friendly.
This app is heavy on RV parking and little about free tent camping.
Who wants to log in or sign up to use a mediocre app?  Not me.

label_title: Nicest RV park in the area.
review:
RV park is located in Del Mar on the fair grounds.
The RV manager Juan is extremely easy to get a hold of (619-240-0736)

You can park any signs of RV or age.

label_title: Constellation Park is a great spot!
review: Know nothing about the area around Wickenburg, we turned to Campendium to find a spot to spend the night on our way to Tucson. Other area campgrounds were full for the night; even so, we look for opportunities to boondock. The dirt road in was easy to navigate in our 28‚Äô Airstream and we found a nice spot that was nearly level. The lights from the town are pretty at night, and if it wasn‚Äôt so unseasonably cold (and then rained off and on most of the night) we would have really enjoyed sitting outside and enjoying the quiet, the view, and the stars. It was easy driving out in the morning even though the ground was very wet from rain. It‚Äôs a great deal for $8!

label_title: No, you don‚Äôt need or get my email address
review: I have no idea why a camping directory needs me to surrender my private email address just to show me information on a nearby campground. And I guess I‚Äôll never find out, because I deleted the app for not respecting my privacy.
Add dog friendly filter

You have my $.   Now I look forward to you fixing the app so I can use it. 

No search available 
No campsites visible
Use his app regularly to find camping sites. Park reviews have been very accurate

label_title: Couldn‚Äôt go camping across the country without this app!
review: Amazing and free!!
The app is amazing but it makes me sign up and when I do it errors out every time and dosnt let me use the email again but the account won‚Äôt work so I can‚Äôt use it

It‚Äôs so easy to use and free. They have ya sign up but it‚Äôs was fast and easy. It locates great areas, doesn‚Äôt crash and always pin points me. If it doesn‚Äôt pick you up and you can‚Äôt find yourself on the map maybe you shouldn‚Äôt be looking to camp in rural sites. Excellent tool. Hopefully those who use this don‚Äôt abuse the areas it‚Äôs helping you visit. Great job!

The campgrounds are immaculate. The Facilities are a little dated but clean and the staff is really nice. There‚Äôs no charge for the showers And there‚Äôs a laundry facility. Bring quarters for that. There‚Äôs a huge lawn area and a play area if you have kids.  The pull in spots seem to be pretty long and spacious. However I‚Äôm judging that on our pick up truck and our little Casita trailer. LOL everything seems big to me!
While traveling I use campendium to find blm/public lands and dry camping style places! I am impressed with the app so far. Five stars.
Grateful to have this app to find dump stations, campgrounds and free places to park.
People are very nice, older park but lots of fun in winter time and a perfect location.
Great place if you want solitude, great views of barges and birds, and a unique setting.
It‚Äôs about time for a modern campground app. Great job.

Great place.. wonderful facilities clean and well taken care of.. the camp host was really a big help with answering any questions you may have.. the only drawback was no lights in the handicapped shower and bathroom. No access for fishing unless you have a boat.. over all it‚Äôs been a quite relaxing stay here
Looking for place to camp? Look no further! This app has everything you need. My go to website and App.

If you enjoy green grass, shade trees, clean grounds, and peace & quiet then look here.  If you need full speed WiFi & the latest big city perfection, and don‚Äôt bring all that with you, then maybe not.  Hard packed gravel & dirt.  Bathrooms are clean and roomy.  Laundry room is the same, uses quarters.  Site management very responsive.  We had no trouble driving and parking our 35‚Äô motor home.  Did I say this place is clean, quiet, peaceful and green?
You should make a offline version. Camp sites and addresses for when the Grid goes down.

label_title: Must provide email after three searches
review: Should be disclosed before install back to their site with no registration required
So far great app to find camps and rest areas!
It would be great if it gave a little more information such as elevation and weather.  But very easy to use and helpful planning family camping trips

I bought this app based on two reviews on YouTube.  They bragged about how useful this app was for finding free camping locations.
I have not found this app to be worth the money, it does not have as complete a set of free and pay sites, as other camping apps I am using.
I would not recommend buying this app.
In addition, after some use, the app REQUIRES you to sign up to continue to use the app.  I didn‚Äôt plan on this.
I absolutely love this app! Soooo helpful! Thank app creators! Lol
30 amp 50 amp. Water sewer. Free. It doesn‚Äôt get any better than this. We will stay here on the way back. We just would have been happy with a parking spot. But Walsh! An oasis on free.
We are on a 2 week road trip and this app has been so helpful! We are finding great campgrounds along the way.

This site is a good source of information for campers. I would recommend it highly. We used this for our first vacationing in new areas we have not been too. 
The information about the campground is limited but with us campers putting in reviews, pictures and information helps others.
I am very glad we found this.:)
Campendium is an excellent amp for finding the right place to camp. The App is very user friendly and so well laid out. We love that they include cell phone coverage in their site info pages!
Searching for a place.  We are newbies and this has been invaluable.  Hope to see a big rig friendly search capability soon.

We recently stayed at the RV Park after the National Park Campgrounds filled up. We can honestly say that it was a great experience staying at San-Suz-Ed. The new owners Jason & Katie (& family) made us fill right at home, and they are making improvements to the campground daily. We were sad to leave after 4 days, and would have loved to stay longer. The RV Park was full, but it never felt crowded and was always peaceful and quiet at night. We had fun sitting around the community campfire in the evenigs and sharing stories while our daughter made new friends. We definitely recommend this campground to anyone looking, and we will be back next year for sure. Some sites are back in, and others are pull through. We stayed in two sites, 17 & 24. Both sites were easy to get in and didn‚Äôt require much to level the trailer, a few block under the tires to help, this is the Mountains after all.
No matter where we are, we‚Äôve found campgrounds that suit our preferences. I love that dispersed camping and boondocking sites are included.

We try to always stay here. Facilities are always clean staff are really nice!!  They have a full schedule for the kids each day if they want to participate. Sites are nice. (WiFi is only close to the office- or the last time we were there)
Best app to find spots to boondock and dump!

Who ever developed this app it‚Äôs great!! I travel a lot and I‚Äôm easily able to find the best rate closest well maintained camp sites around me. Easy to use accurate fast. I consider this app part of my camping gear!
App could not find my location.  Just error messages
I was very excited to use this app. However, it keeps crashing and I have to start my search all over. Not sure I‚Äôll keep it.

label_title: Can‚Äôt create an account, can‚Äôt see parks
review: You can‚Äôt look around without creating an account. I couldn‚Äôt remember my password so I reset it but it kept saying I had to verify my account but it wouldn‚Äôt say how or where. Going to RV PARKY. Easier to use.

The app is invaluable in finding campsites both off the beaten path in BLM or forest service land as well as in national parks with larger campgrounds. Great filters and information from reviewers.

However, I‚Äôve tried several times to review multiple campsites within the app and it is not saving those reviews - I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs a bug or just me doing something wrong, but it would be nice if I could contribute with reviews on the campgrounds I‚Äôve visited.
Shouldn't be forced to sign up at all. Didn't get into one search before the pop-up demanded I sign up! Personally I'd rather have the option after using it...

label_title: The quickest & easiest way to find a place to live!
review:
I love this app! 

The website has always been great but I‚Äôm totally excited that there‚Äôs an app now. I‚Äôm on my phone all the time, so this has been a real game changer. 

I honestly can‚Äôt believe how many FREE campsites there are to choose from. I‚Äôve been able to find at least one in every state we‚Äôve been to (30 so far!).

10/10 definitely recommend!!

Campendium is my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù app for finding great places to camp.  Not only is the database among the most complete,  but the users put a lot of time and effort into writing their reviews which are among the most detailed available anywhere. Don‚Äôt leave home without this app!

I love this app! Well maintained and the peer reviews are great. 

Only two items I‚Äôd change would be an easier option for signing in and a way to ‚ÄúStar‚Äù or ‚Äúfavorite‚Äù where I have been and where I‚Äôd like to go. Much like a wishlist.

Why can‚Äôt I create ‚Äúlists‚Äù and ‚Äúbookmarks‚Äù? It‚Äôs a pretty massive failure for this app to allow me to research campgrounds and then I have to copy and paste the info into a different app. Seriously?! I‚Äôll use other apps if that‚Äôs the case.

label_title: By far the best! Simplemente la mejor.
review:
Seriously guys, if you are into Rving, camping and road trips this app right here is a must have.

Si les gusta acampar con casas m√≥viles o simplemente viajar por carretera est√° es la aplicaci√≥n que necesitan.

label_title: Our Go To app for finding camps
review:
Campendium is our number one tool to find our next camping destination. There‚Äôs a great wealth of information and photos on so many campsites, RV park and campgrounds. The app makes it easy to search by location. Once you have found that perfect spot, click on maps for immediate directions. You can also go right to the campsites website or reservations link. 

Great app and a great solution.
This is my go to app to find awesome camping sites and to check on cell coverage. Thanks for making an awesome app!!
Love this app. If I could add one feature it would be to select the future bucket list campgrounds in a favorite list.

My husband and I have been on the road for nine months and just found out about Campendium about two months ago. It has been a life changer. We have camped for free in some of the most beautiful places! We have camped directly on the rim of the Grand Canyon in Arizona, with the view of Twin lakes in Colorado, on the Vermillion Cliffs in Utah and many other wonderful places. Most places will have a fire ring as well! So thankful it has become an app! The app works so well and we are excited to continue to use it! @mcgee.ventures

label_title: Love the mission, love the application!
review: We are super excited to be using the campendium app! Their website is wonderful and I'm sure the app will be even better!
Finally, this stellar app takes the authority of online campground reviews to the next level. As a full-time RVer I cannot thank the developers enough for this invaluable resource!
This app is crazy useful. I love Campendium!
We love the filters and map function!
So happy this is finally out! Campendium is how I find most of my campsites, and now it's going to be all that easier to access it. Thanks guys!

label_title: The only camping app you should use.
review: If you are new to camping or a seasoned pro, this app offers the most reliable reviews for campgrounds.

We've been using the Campendium website for the past 3 years, and it took our full timing to the next level. Now with the convenience of just opening the app, it's just unbelievable. Why spend time Googling campgrounds or scouring NF or BLM maps for spots that may or may not work out. Just open the app find what kind of spot suits your needs, and you'll know exactly what to expect when you get there.

As a full-time traveler, the Campendium website has been an indispensable tool in my arsenal since its inception. This app is a game changer, as it's so simple to research places to stay now on the fly on my phone. Everything works great, and all the info is right where I need it. Great filters, maps, and so easy to use and find the info I want. Bravo!
...and it's perfect. Best resource to plan a journey, or when you need to change plans on the fly. Thank you for creating this app!

label_title: Best camping destination review and finder app
review:
I always refer to Campendium first when picking camping destinations...now things have become even easier with the app. The user interface is intuitive and the campground reviews (including cell coverage) from REAL people who have stayed there is super useful. Reviews also include photos from reviewers, not campground owners, so I feel like I'm getting a better idea of what the campground actually looks like before I decide to stay there. It also makes it easy to find boondocking options. 
I love this app!

My husband and I have used Campendium for the past 2 years to find the best campsites in America, Canada and Mexico. The cell service reports are awesome because working online is how we fund our travels. Great campsites, informative reviews, and the only place to find cell reports, too. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Campendium is my go to when finding places to stay in our RV.  I am glad all the things I love about the website were put into this app. The app makes it so much easier when we are traveling to find an RV park with reviews and places to boondock when we want to get away from it all.  This is a must have for people traveling in an RV!

Put in a few dozen searches and used the map markers to bring the selection to top of list. Nice feature. Seems accurate as I used a few spots we have camped that are off the grid ... got usable results. A nice tool to have in the trVels

Just like their website, which we have been using for years... this app has amazing filters to help you find the kind of site you want!  We rarely make plans and this helps us find amazing places as we travel (full-time for nearly 3yrs).  We work from the road and this is THE app/website to use to know before you commit to a campground or boondocking spot if the cell signals are usable.

I've been using Campendium's website for a long time when looking for campsites. This app makes it more convenient. It's accurate and fast.
Someday it would be nice to be able to download info and save it, so one could use when off the grid. 
Now, I'll continue to plan ahead and search  for sites when online. This is a great tool!

label_title: Excellent resource for all your camping adventures!
review:
We have been a huge fan of Campendium from the beginning so we are thrilled that now there is an app! 

So far it has worked exceptionally well and it's very streamlined and simple to use. Will be using it for all our future travels!

Cheers!
Boondock or Bust
Cool app!
Yay Campendium is now an App üéâ
